Job Title: Global Program Director EP2P - Amsterdam or Dublin - Europe
Job Description:
Country: Netherlands
City: Amsterdam
Req ID: 272500
About CRH
CRH is the leading global diversified building materials business in the world, employing more than 70,000 people at 3,100 locations worldwide. We manufacture and supply a diverse range of superior building materials and products, used extensively in the built environment, in infrastructure, housing and commercial construction projects, of all sizes, all across the world. Each day, millions of people around the world come into contact with our materials and products which help fulfill the basic human need of shelter and the infrastructure we need for our societies to thrive.
Position Overview
We’re looking for a talented and suitably qualified leader to join us as the owner of the Electronic Procure to Pay (EP2P) program management in the role of Global Program Director EP2P based in our offices in Amsterdam or Dublin. In this exciting and challenging role you will be focused on the implementation, ownership and maintenance of the project management process (PMP) along with the coaching of functional leaders within the program regarding the use of the PMP. The purpose of the role is to achieve consistency and a recognisable way of managing change projects as well as ensuring knowledge retention across the procurement and finance functions with a successful implementation of EP2P across the group.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
In this role you will be responsible for a number of tasks including:
Program management excellence; i.e. building close and effective relationships with key internal and external stakeholders including the Program Steering Committee; Procurement, Finance, IT Leadership, HR and third-party suppliers
Leading an agile way of working with project teams and SMEs to deliver best practice PMP to implement EP2P and related process changes
Delivering program governance standards that are maintained across the project, including SteerCo, delivery and reporting
Developing local PMP including how CRH work, with a particular focus on approach, readiness assessments, implementation of tools and processes, Operating Companies and supplier on-boarding
Ensuring a consistent level of quality in project management across the program
Following up on planning and facilitation of gate reviews across the different (change) projects with the project and stream leads
Maintaining a single program overview for ease of reporting to relevant leadership teams - Global Leadership Team; Procurement; Finance; IT; HR and Global Procurement Council. containing a clear benefit realisation plan and ensuring all tangible benefits are captured throughout the transformation
Coaching of program team members and stream leads as required
Key competencies and relevant experience
To be successful in this role you will need to be educated to degree level in either a business or IT related subject and possess proven senior procurement experience gained in a large, matrixed organisation. Your extensive experience in program management in an international setting should be complimented by your proven experience in people management. You should be fluent in both written and verbal English, other languages are considered advantageous. As this is global role with an international remit there will be extensive travel (up to 50%).
You’ll be an experienced and ambitious senior procurement leader with demonstrable business acumen who has managed global or regional procurement implementation programmes. Your well rounded professional approach is supported by your sound business acumen. You’ll be driven and proactive in your desire to support the execution of the strategic procurement agenda by coordinating process improvement projects and transformations including change management and communications.
As a dedicated and engaged team player you’ll collaborate readily with the both the global and regional functions in and outside Procurement such as Finance/IT/HR and strive for continuous improvement of our procurement operating model.
As a global employer CRH are also able to offer this opportunity to be based out of America, click here for further details.
What CRH Offers You
 A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion
Highly competitive base pay
Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
Group retirement savings program
Health and wellness programs
Excellent opportunities to develop and progress with a global organisation
WORKING AT CRH
As a multinational and multicultural organization, CRH recognizes that our diverse and talented global workforce is critical to sustaining competitive advantage and long-term success. At CRH we want to challenge all of our employees to reach their full potential and play their part in the success of our business. We place a strong focus on developing and empowering our employees to help ensure that we have the talent and capabilities we need now and in the future. We also strive to provide an attractive, rewarding and stimulating modern work environment that will engage and inspire our employees to meet the ever evolving standards and expectations of our customers.
COMPENSATION
We offer an international workplace with a lot of opportunities, freedom and flexibility. As such, self – starters who enjoy working in a challenging environment and who can play a role in shaping our future are encouraged to join CRH. We take care of our employees and therefore offer a generous total rewards package, a diverse and inclusive culture and professional development opportunities.

Business/Communications degrees a plusDemonstrated success in a sales-driven career, attaining and exceeding sales targetsExperience in construction, building, coatings or architectural industry an assetExperience with CRMHard-working, assertive and self-motivatedAbility to take direction, while also demonstrating success in leading teams and effortsSuperior time management skills, coupled with the ability to organize and prioritizeAbility to make independent decisions in a fast-paced environmentRequirements: Ability to travel up to 50% during peak timesStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work full time hours; more when required in peak seasons in order to reach sales targetsMust have a full driver’s licenseIf interested, please respond by submitting your resume.We thank all interested candidates, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Sansin Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Business/Communications degrees a plusDemonstrated success in a sales-driven career, attaining and exceeding sales targetsExperience in construction, building, coatings or architectural industry an assetExperience with CRMHard-working, assertive and self-motivatedAbility to take direction, while also demonstrating success in leading teams and effortsSuperior time management skills, coupled with the ability to organize and prioritizeAbility to make independent decisions in a fast-paced environmentRequirements: Ability to travel up to 50% during peak timesStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work full time hours; more when required in peak seasons in order to reach sales targetsMust have a full driver’s licenseIf interested, please respond by submitting your resume.We thank all interested candidates, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Sansin Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minority groups. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: €35,000.00 - €50,000.00 per yearApplication Question(s):Are you willing and able to travel 50%? Job Description

DPR Construction is seeking a Project EHS lead who can support our projects in the Netherlands.


In this role you will be responsible and accountable for the Environmental, Health & Safety Management function on a large project or multiple smaller projects. These will typically be commercial projects within our core markets of Advanced Technology and Life Sciences. We are looking for someone with demonstrable experience of working on large construction sites, who is locally based or has an existing work permit for the Netherlands.

The Project EHS lead will engage with all members of the Project Team and is responsible for a sustainable EHS culture.

Responsibilities

Develop, implement and review the organization’s Health and Safety Policies and procedures/guidance. As the EHS Project lead, you will be the point of contact on a major construction project for any and every health & safety matter.

At the very minimum local statutory compliance, but more importantly through continual engagement and continual championing of the Fundamentals of Safety the development of a true Injury Free Environment (IFE) culture as an integral part of how we do business.
All operations are carried out with due consideration for protection of the environment, the prevention of pollution and the continual improvement of our environmental performance.

Qualifications
5+ years of experience in a Senior Project EHS lead role, preferably within DPR’s core markets
Recognized qualification in Environmental, Health and Safety Management and any additional local minimum local certification / qualification requirements required for the role
Full understanding of applicable local EHS Legislation, work methods, approaches to EHS and cultural norms
Experience in Life science is a strong advantage
Fluent in English and Dutch language skills an added bonus
Proficient skills in Microsoft Office Suite
A strong work ethic and a “can-do” attitude
Excellent listening skills and strong communication skills
A positive outlook of life generally and good sense of humor.
What we offer


A chance to join a global leader in the Data Centre & Life Science construction market
A great opportunity within a rapidly growing business to develop and accelerate your career
An ambitious, professional, and international team with a flat hierarchy
A dynamic and innovative work environment
Competitive salary
Employee Benefits as gym reimbursement, Employee Assistance Program and health/medical insurance

A flat, title-less organization that empowers people at all levels to make decisions, DPR ranked on FORTUNE’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” list for five consecutive years. DPR has been nationally recognized for its strong company culture, based on a well-defined purpose “We Exist to Build Great Things,” and four core values: integrity, enjoyment, uniqueness and ever forward. A flat, title-less organization that empowers people at all levels to make decisions, DPR ranked on FORTUNE’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” list for five consecutive years. About JLG, an Oshkosh company
JLG began in 1969, when our founder, John L. Grove set out to resolve growing safety concerns in the construction industry. Since then we have been committed to understanding the challenges and delivering innovative solutions to the access market. We partner with customers to provide quality equipment, training opportunities and trusted support within the access industry. We are a global company, and our products—including mobile elevating work platforms, telehandlers, utility vehicles and accessories—can be found all over the world.
The team
In total about 60 people work in our European Shared Service Centre in Hoofddorp in Finance, HR, Sales, Marketing and Legal. The Finance department consists of over 15 professionals. Candidates that like to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment and feel well in a culturally diverse working place are likely to be successful.
The role

The GL Accountant will be part of the GL (Accounting) team. In this role you will report to the Supervisor Accounting. For this position you will be located in our Shared Services Center in Hoofddorp, The Netherlands.
The purpose of this position is to perform general accounting functions and assist in the statutory process within a fast-growing international company. In this capacity your role is a link between activities in the United States and the EMEA Region (Europe, Middle East and Africa). Tasks include month-end and statutory reporting for one or more legal entities and involvement in financial projects. The successful applicant will work closely together with other finance departments (Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Financial Planning & Analysis, and Payroll) to ensure control and compliance.
The successful candidate will be involved with the functions listed below:
Coordinate, assist and drive the preparation and completion of Audits (Group, Statutory, Internal, SOX and Tax) of assigned legal entities
Perform and manage month end close activities.
Perform monthly Blackline balance sheet reconciliations and ensure variances are resolved.
Own the monthly, quarterly and annual closing of one or more EMEA legal entities.
Liaison with Corporate tax function/ external tax consultants and ensure the timely filing of corporate income tax and local statistical reporting.
Propose and drive changes and improvements in the accounting process.
Prepare, validate and make journal entries for designated companies.
Create and maintain a strong environment to enable information gathering for fiscal, legal and accounting purposes.
Support process improvements and system implementations to ensure enhancements of reporting processes across the EMEA locations.
Participate in regional balance sheet and cost reviews with decision support teams.
Preparation of local tax reports.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting, or a relevant field.
At least 3 years of relevant accounting experience, preferably in an international environment.
An experienced Auditor without accounting experience can also be considered for this role.
Multiple-country GL Accounting experience is advantageous.
Knowledge of Dutch tax legislation is advantageous.
Fluent in English. Knowledge of other European languages is advantageous.
Knowledge of Financial / Accounting ERP systems.
Knowledge of MS Office.
Desired Competencies:
Excellent analytical skills and an excellent level of accuracy.
“Hands-on” mentality.
Shows initiative and provides good follow-up on areas of responsibility, especially in the area of the accounting process.
Teamplayer. Together we are better.

As a fiberglass worker at Saffier Yachts you work together with a group of 5 to 6 colleagues on the construction of the boats. Your work consists of cutting the polyester mats to size, laminating in the molds and finishing all polyester parts for our seven Saffiers models.

Job requirements:

Work experience required
Independent
Experience with processing fiberglass and laminating is required
Exactly and are keen to produce a top product
No 9 to 5 mentality and you are prepared to extra work overtime if necessary
It is a 40 hour working week, compensation is in accordance with your experience and collective labor agreement.

Do you find it a challenge to work for a leading shipyard that has won international and national awards and are you looking for work that you can be really proud of at the end of the week? Then you are our man or women.

You can send applications or more information about this vacancy to the attention of Dean Hennevanger to jobs@saffieryachts.com, or call or drop by.

Saffier Yachts
Rondweg 20
1976 BW IJmuiden
The Netherlands
Tel: +31255 512 860

Job Title: Senior / Project Managers - Data Centre Construction - MEP/CSA
Job Description:
Company Description

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.
Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects, in over 110 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Turner & Townsend are leaders in professional services to the Data Centre’s / R&D facilities / Distribution & Logistics centres / Manufacturing facilities for Aerospace, Automotive, FMCG and Pharmaceutical sectors globally.
Due to the continued success and expansion of our European Data Centre business we are looking to speak with Project Management Professionals who have experience in working on Data Centre projects.
Job Objectives
Manage overall project cost, schedule and budgets.
Manage General Contractor and other directly contracted vendors and consultants.
Analyse, track and effectively manage critical milestone activities to avoid schedule slip.
Review construction proposals and related pricing/scopes.
Review, correct and assess work-in-place, to approve capital expenditure spends.
Review and approve cost loaded schedules.
Run and lead client and other required meetings.
Identify factors that influence construction costs and monitor and report on this data.
Knowledge and experience with all methods of construction procurement and long lead equipment.
Review, validate and audit cost estimates prepared by contractors and others within a client’s organization.
Support engineering decisions relating to the project cost and budget while design-build changes take place during construction.
Review requests for payment.
Track and ensure equipment meets the project schedule.
Record occurrence that might result in a claim - acting on the client’s behalf.
Advocate on the part of the client during disputes, disagreements, modifications, or change orders.
Coordinate and oversee scheduling consultant reviews on the project.
Review and approve final invoices, payment applications, retention payments.
Oversee and manage the transfer of the building operations to the client including all close out documentation and warranties.
Skills / Experience Required
DUTCH Language skills highly desirable.
Experience as a Senior Project Manager plus a minimum of 2 years sector experience in Data Centers or related hi tech asset type.
Knowledge of Structural, Civil, Plumbing, Mechanical, Electrical and Low Voltage scopes of work.
Advanced skills with spreadsheets, report writing and presentations.
Strong and professional communication skills, with great organization skills, ability to multi-task.
Must have a “team attitude”, be self-motivated and be willing to support other groups and projects when required.
Entrepreneurial thinking, creativity and dynamism.
Flexible mobility advantageous.

Qualifications

University degree in Construction Management or a related field.
Member of a Professional Institute preferred.
Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.
We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.
Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.
Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/
#LI-GS1

Job Title: Senior / Project Managers - Data Centre Construction - MEP/CSA
Job Description:
Company Description

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realize their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.
Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects, in over 110 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Turner & Townsend are leaders in professional services to the Data Centre’s / R&D facilities / Distribution & Logistics centres / Manufacturing facilities for Aerospace, Automotive, FMCG and Pharmaceutical sectors globally.
Due to the continued success and expansion of our European Data Centre business we are looking to speak with Project Management Professionals who have experience in working on Data Centre projects.
Job Objectives
Manage overall project cost, schedule and budgets.
Manage General Contractor and other directly contracted vendors and consultants.
Analyse, track and effectively manage critical milestone activities to avoid schedule slip.
Review construction proposals and related pricing/scopes.
Review, correct and assess work-in-place, to approve capital expenditure spends.
Review and approve cost loaded schedules.
Run and lead client and other required meetings.
Identify factors that influence construction costs and monitor and report on this data.
Knowledge and experience with all methods of construction procurement and long lead equipment.
Review, validate and audit cost estimates prepared by contractors and others within a client’s organization.
Support engineering decisions relating to the project cost and budget while design-build changes take place during construction.
Review requests for payment.
Track and ensure equipment meets the project schedule.
Record occurrence that might result in a claim - acting on the client’s behalf.
Advocate on the part of the client during disputes, disagreements, modifications, or change orders.
Coordinate and oversee scheduling consultant reviews on the project.
Review and approve final invoices, payment applications, retention payments.
Oversee and manage the transfer of the building operations to the client including all close out documentation and warranties.
Skills / Experience Required
DUTCH Language skills highly desirable.
Experience as a Senior Project Manager plus a minimum of 2 years sector experience in Data Centers or related hi tech asset type.
Knowledge of Structural, Civil, Plumbing, Mechanical, Electrical and Low Voltage scopes of work.
Advanced skills with spreadsheets, report writing and presentations.
Strong and professional communication skills, with great organization skills, ability to multi-task.
Must have a “team attitude”, be self-motivated and be willing to support other groups and projects when required.
Entrepreneurial thinking, creativity and dynamism.
Flexible mobility advantageous.

Qualifications

University degree in Construction Management or a related field.
Member of a Professional Institute preferred.

Amazon is seeking a highly motivated Finance Analyst to join the exciting world of Amazon WW Real Estate Finance in our EU headquarters. We are not an average retailer and this is definitely not an average finance position. We will give you the opportunity to make a real difference to our business. We are looking for exceptional people with good numeracy and great financial and technical skills.

In this position, you will create, develop and implement uniform investment and finance analysis standards for Amazon Real Estate projects, provide guidance to the Business and Finance partners from multiple Amazon businesses on analyzing investment projects, collaborate in establishing Amazon worldwide financing strategy for investment projects. This role will have heavy impact and high visibility to essential, business-critical processes, and will require interactions with internal stakeholders at all levels of the organization. You will be responsible for creation of master financial models, tools and frameworks, assessing alternative financing options and providing thorough data-driven recommendations. You will leverage your educational and applied work experience to direct initiatives to recognize and define opportunities in multiple Amazon businesses

Key Responsibilities:

Promote standardization and alignment of best financial analysis practices across WW Operations businesses
Provide financial analysis, ROI and NPV models for Real Estate and Construction projects, with a focus on unique and complicated cases we could have in Amazon worldwide
Direct the implementation of early financial analysis for Real Estate projects, with customization based on specifics of different businesses under WW Operations umbrella
Work with internal stakeholders and business leaders on preparing and implementing recommendations for improvements to analysis
Collaborate with WW Treasury on a strategy on financing the Amazon Real Estate portfolio expansion, and support execution of this strategy with regional Finance and Business teams

The suitable candidate will have a proven ability in providing data-driven decision making and analysis as well as thinking strategically in a fast-changing environment.


Good operational business understanding, including potential impact of business decisions on various internal/external stakeholders
CFA (Level I or more advanced)
Ability to develop new ideas and creative solutions.
Comfort with working in an ambiguous environment.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

Bachelor degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or other quantitative area or other degree with equivalent experience.
4+ years of relevant work experience.
Advanced skills in Excel, and at least 2 years of experience in performing financial and ad hoc analysis using advanced Excel.
Fluent English

Job Description:
In the Critical Environments Instrumentation Technician role (CEIT) you will have an opportunity to work alongside a dynamic team of industry professionals across the Information Technology (IT) and Critical Environments (CE) spectrum within Microsoft 24x7x365 mission-critical datacenters. You will be an Industrial Controls Systems (ICS) subject-matter-expert with accountabilities that include but are not limited to maintaining ICS availability, data quality, service and change management, reporting, and the security of all ICS systems and applications that monitor, control, host, transport, and deliver telemetry. You will collaborate closely with Microsoft’s local Datacenter Operations teams to maintain ICS high availability and security and provide hands-on escalation support, oversight, and guidance. You will own site level ICS program and project management, and both govern and directly participate in the execution of global initiatives related to ICS systems. You will govern logical and physical access, approval, and permissions related to all ICS systems, networks, workstations, and servers that provide datacenter monitoring, controls, and telemetry. From assisting DC Operations with maintenance & safety procedures (via monitoring system outputs), to operating and maintaining these systems directly, you will be a steward of vital ICS infrastructure.
#COICareers
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Managing, servicing, and governing Microsoft’s electrical and mechanical industrial control systems (ICS) to include servers, applications, networks, and device infrastructure deployed within Microsoft’s 24x7x365 mission-critical datacenters. You will be the technical resource for these monitoring and control services, ensuring availability and telemetry for critical electrical and mechanical controls systems. You will be the immediate technical resource and point of escalation for CE vendors for IC Systems.
Excellent customer service, interpersonal awareness, and communication skills will be pivotal in bringing your project management and technical abilities to life, supporting Microsoft’s future success!
Qualifications
Qualifications:
3+ Years of experience in an operational, mission-critical, 24x7x365 facility
1.5+ Years of experience in the design and/or commissioning of Industrial Controls Systems (ICS) in datacenter critical environments.
1+ years of experience with deployment, configuration, and troubleshooting of networks and the Modbus and BACnet protocols
Established understanding of Electrical Power Monitoring Systems (EPMS) and/or Branch Circuit Monitoring (BCM) and/or Building Automation Systems (BAS), and/or Battery Monitoring Systems (BMS)
2+ Years of experience with the operation and maintenance of building electrical systems (Power distribution, lighting, grounding, fire alarm, security, life safety, and related controls systems)
2+ Years of experience with the operation and maintenance of building cooling and related mechanical systems (HVAC, Chilled Water, DX Refrigerant, Evaporative, and related controls systems)
1+ years of experience with Critical IT Equipment (e.g. Servers, SANs, Networking gear, Fiber distribution, etc.)
Bachelor’s degree or applicable field experience in Critical Environments, Electrical, Industrial, Mechanical, or Process Engineering
Knowledge of construction techniques and terminology including the ability to read and interpret blueprints, construction drawings and documents is essential.
Occasional travel will be involved.
Preferred:
Project management experience with a focus on agile, lean or ITIL methodologies.
Ability to manage, prioritize and successfully execute multiple concurrent mission-critical infrastructure projects.
Working knowledge of contract terms, conditions, mechanism, and procedures.
Experience with configuration and administration of Microsoft Windows, Hyper-V, SQL server and associated security methods and best practices.
Experience managing vendors as a customer
Ability to manage, prioritize and successfully execute multiple concurrent mission-critical infrastructure projects.
Ability to balance competing demands for resources and adapt to changing priorities.
Proven ability to deliver projects on-time and adherence to deadlines.
Proven ability to motivate disparate teams both direct and indirect to solve issues.
Proven ability to apply clear critical thinking in complex, stressful situations.
Provide meaningful and timely reporting for weekly success metrics.
Background Check Requirements:
Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:
Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter
Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.
Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Job Description:
In the Critical Environments Instrumentation Technician role (CEIT) you will have an opportunity to work alongside a dynamic team of industry professionals across the Information Technology (IT) and Critical Environments (CE) spectrum within Microsoft 24x7x365 mission-critical datacenters. You will be an Industrial Controls Systems (ICS) subject-matter-expert with accountabilities that include but are not limited to maintaining ICS availability, data quality, service and change management, reporting, and the security of all ICS systems and applications that monitor, control, host, transport, and deliver telemetry. You will collaborate closely with Microsoft’s local Datacenter Operations teams to maintain ICS high availability and security and provide hands-on escalation support, oversight, and guidance. You will own site level ICS program and project management, and both govern and directly participate in the execution of global initiatives related to ICS systems. You will govern logical and physical access, approval, and permissions related to all ICS systems, networks, workstations, and servers that provide datacenter monitoring, controls, and telemetry. From assisting DC Operations with maintenance & safety procedures (via monitoring system outputs), to operating and maintaining these systems directly, you will be a steward of vital ICS infrastructure.
#COICareers
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Managing, servicing, and governing Microsoft’s electrical and mechanical industrial control systems (ICS) to include servers, applications, networks, and device infrastructure deployed within Microsoft’s 24x7x365 mission-critical datacenters. You will be the technical resource for these monitoring and control services, ensuring availability and telemetry for critical electrical and mechanical controls systems. You will be the immediate technical resource and point of escalation for CE vendors for IC Systems.
Excellent customer service, interpersonal awareness, and communication skills will be pivotal in bringing your project management and technical abilities to life, supporting Microsoft’s future success!

Qualifications:
3+ Years of experience in an operational, mission-critical, 24x7x365 facility
1.5+ Years of experience in the design and/or commissioning of Industrial Controls Systems (ICS) in datacenter critical environments.
1+ years of experience with deployment, configuration, and troubleshooting of networks and the Modbus and BACnet protocols
Established understanding of Electrical Power Monitoring Systems (EPMS) and/or Branch Circuit Monitoring (BCM) and/or Building Automation Systems (BAS), and/or Battery Monitoring Systems (BMS)
2+ Years of experience with the operation and maintenance of building electrical systems (Power distribution, lighting, grounding, fire alarm, security, life safety, and related controls systems)
2+ Years of experience with the operation and maintenance of building cooling and related mechanical systems (HVAC, Chilled Water, DX Refrigerant, Evaporative, and related controls systems)
1+ years of experience with Critical IT Equipment (e.g. Servers, SANs, Networking gear, Fiber distribution, etc.)
Bachelor’s degree or applicable field experience in Critical Environments, Electrical, Industrial, Mechanical, or Process Engineering
Knowledge of construction techniques and terminology including the ability to read and interpret blueprints, construction drawings and documents is essential.
Occasional travel will be involved.
Preferred:
Project management experience with a focus on agile, lean or ITIL methodologies.
Ability to manage, prioritize and successfully execute multiple concurrent mission-critical infrastructure projects.
Working knowledge of contract terms, conditions, mechanism, and procedures.
Experience with configuration and administration of Microsoft Windows, Hyper-V, SQL server and associated security methods and best practices.
Experience managing vendors as a customer
Ability to manage, prioritize and successfully execute multiple concurrent mission-critical infrastructure projects.

Are you our new Senior Interior Designer?
Marcel Wanders studio is an internationally renowned design studio where Graphic, Product and Interior designers collaborate under one roof. Together with our talented international team of approximately 40 specialists, we realize exciting projects for premium brands and private clients around the globe.
Our mission is to ‘create an environment of love, live with passion, and make our most exciting dreams come true’. Our thriving, inspiring studio space is located in the heart of the spirited Dutch capital, Amsterdam.

Full-time · Amsterdam

Does this sounds like the kind of place you want to work? Well, read on, because we’re currently looking for a talented

Senior Interior Designer

As a Senior Interior Designer you will work on high-end interior design projects in the hospitality, residential, work space and retail sectors. You are able to interpret design briefs, develop imaginative story-telling, and create strong and innovative concepts keeping the narrative style of the Marcel Wanders studio.

You provide continuous overview and are comfortable with all stages of interior design – from initial concepts to detailed design through construction. You are self-organized, and provide flexibility and ability to work on several projects at the same time. In our team of Interior Designers you are the person who provides solutions to design challenges and maintain oversight of project deliverables and with your knowledge and experience you provide guidance to the other designers in the team.

You are highly experienced with understanding architectural plans, and equally with preparing mood boards, drawings, models, specifications and documents to clearly define interior design works. In your role as a Senior Interior Designer you are experienced in working with other consultants, engineers, contractors, fabricators, and regulatory agencies to meet overall project objectives. As a proactive and energetic team player you add value to our team and together we bring our magnificent ideas into reality.

About you

8+ years of relevant professional experience

Extensive background in architectural and interior design
Excellent technical drawings skills – interpreting, using, preparing (AutoCad, Vectorworks)
Excellent Adobe Creative Suite and Office 365 skills
Skilled in free-hand sketches & modeling programs
Able to work in a team as well as independently
Fluent in English – both spoken and written. Knowledge of the Dutch language is an advantage
Living in Amsterdam or willing to relocate to Amsterdam
EU passport holder or in possession of a valid Dutch work permit (we do not sponsor candidates)


Acquisition to this vacancy is not appreciated.

Apply for the job

We are looking for an enthusiastic candidate with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics. Would you like to work in an international research group in an academic environment? Please apply at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.


In medicine, the interest in molecular imaging has exploded in the last decade. Direct in vivo molecular imaging will become increasingly important as therapies become more specialized and molecule-specific to the disease. This requires visualizing molecular expression and molecular interaction at the cellular level and imaging in detail tissue structure and function in vivo .


The goal of the NWO-TTW Perspectief program “Medical Photonics - MEDPHOT” is to develop and validate photonics-based imaging technologies that enable earlier diagnosis and better and/or tailored treatment of diseases and translate these technologies to a clinical environment in collaborative projects with clinical opinion leaders in pulmonology, urology, and gastroenterology and industrial partners. Advanced physics concepts based on interferometry and cutting-edge technology will be developed to reach these goals.


Within the MEDPHOT program we focus on the development of hybrid optical technologies for combined structural and molecular specific imaging, including the development of novel catheters and capsules specifically optimized for combined detection. Specifically, at the VU high-end OCT systems will be developed that combine structural with targeted fluorescence imaging, i.e., an integrated immuno-OCT platform. New catheters will be designed for multifunctional imaging based on a double clad fiber design. In close collaboration with UMC Groningen (Prof. Nagengast), these catheters will be tested in pilot studies on patients. Algorithms to extract the scattering and absorbing properties of the tissues as well as the concentration of fluorescent contrast agents from the optical signals, for different tissues, will be developed. Polarization properties of tissue and materials have attracted interest in medicine and in industry. The detection of polarization changes are a prime interest, where these properties will be determined not only in tissue but also in collaboration with ASML in semiconductor materials.


Location: AMSTERDAM

FTE: 1
Job description
For this project, we are looking for a PhD student who will develop the measurements systems, develop the advanced processing algorithms for polarization properties, polarization mode dispersion and quantitative fluorescence, and perform the data analysis of in vivo human data, as well as measurements on selected wafer samples provided by ASML. The research will be conducted at the VU in Amsterdam, with regular visits to the UMC Groningen. The candidate will be part of a larger group of PhD students that collaborate closely to reach the final goals of the MEDPHOT program, and are embedded in the Biophotonics research group at the VU under supervision of Prof. Dr. J.F. de Boer.


Your duties
the PhD student will further develop probes for the esophagus, collaborate on the further design and construction of the measurement systems, and develop an excellent understanding of light propagation principles and processing methods to extract tissue information as part of the MEDPHOT program. In collaboration with ASML, the optical properties of sample wafers will be studied
the PhD student will assist in clinical pilot studies by performing the data analysis and interpretation
Requirements
For this position we are looking for an enthusiastic candidate
with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics
candidates should have good understanding of optics, have computational skills (Matlab, Labview) and be able to communicate in English both verbally and in writing. The project’s results will be presented on national and international medical and technical conferences and in relevant journals. The successful candidate is expected to write a dissertation leading to a PhD degree towards the end of the 4-year project
What are we offering?
A challenging position in a socially involved organization. On full-time basis the remuneration amounts to a minimum gross monthly salary of €2,395 (PhD) and a maximum €3,061 (PhD), depending on your education and experience. The job profile is based on the university job ranking system and is vacant for 1 FTE.


The initial employment contract will affect a period of 1 year. After a satisfactory evaluation of the initial appointment, the contract will be extended for a total duration of 4 years.


Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good work/life balance, such as:
a maximum of 41 days of annual leave based on full-time employment
8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus
solid pension scheme (ABP)
optional model for designing a personalized benefits package

About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavor – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.


Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.


Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.


The Faculty of Science

The Faculty of Science inspires researchers and students to find sustainable solutions for complex societal issues. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to medicines and from molecules to the moon: our teaching and research programmes cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. We share knowledge and experience with leading research institutes and industries, both here in the Netherlands and abroad.


Working at the Faculty of Science means working with students, PhD candidates and researchers, all with a clear focus on their field and a broad view of the world. We employ more than 1,250 staff members, and we are home to around 6,000 students.


About the department of Physics and Astronomy

The Department of Physics and Astronomy at VU Amsterdam offers an active and engaged intellectual community composed of researchers from around the world. Research is focused on four themes: (i) high-energy and gravitational physics, (ii) quantum metrology and laser applications, (iii) physics of life and health, and (iv) physics of photosynthesis and energy. The department is involved in teaching in the programs Physics and Astronomy (joint degree with the University of Amsterdam), Science Business and Innovation, Medical Natural Sciences (all three BSc and MSc), and the BSc program in Mechanical Engineering (together with University of Twente). Furthermore, the department has a strong track record in valorization of its research, including translational research to the clinic (often together with the Amsterdam UMC, location VUmc (on campus) and location AMC), collaborations with industry (e.g. ARCNL), and a thriving startup scene.
Application
Are you interested in this position? Applicants are requested to respond before May, 1 2021 via the application button by uploading the following documents:
a letter in which they describe their abilities and motivation
accompanied by a detailed curriculum vitae with two or three references
a list of grades, TOEFL and/or IETLS scores (if available)
and a sample of a written report in English
The job interviews are scheduled to take place between 10 - 14 May 2021, if possible, please take them into account when applying for the position.


Applications received by e-mail will not be processed.


Vacancy questions

For additional information about this position, please contact:

Research is focused on four themes: (i) high-energy and gravitational physics, (ii) quantum metrology and laser applications, (iii) physics of life and health, and (iv) physics of photosynthesis and energy. The department is involved in teaching in the programs Physics and Astronomy (joint degree with the University of Amsterdam), Science Business and Innovation, Medical Natural Sciences (all three BSc and MSc), and the BSc program in Mechanical Engineering (together with University of Twente). Furthermore, the department has a strong track record in valorization of its research, including translational research to the clinic (often together with the Amsterdam UMC, location VUmc (on campus) and location AMC), collaborations with industry (e.g. ARCNL), and a thriving startup scene.
Application
Are you interested in this position? Applicants are requested to respond before May, 1 2021 via the application button by uploading the following documents:
a letter in which they describe their abilities and motivation
accompanied by a detailed curriculum vitae with two or three references
a list of grades, TOEFL and/or IETLS scores (if available)
and a sample of a written report in English
The job interviews are scheduled to take place between 10 - 14 May 2021, if possible, please take them into account when applying for the position.


Applications received by e-mail will not be processed.


Vacancy questions

For additional information about this position, please contact:


Name: Prof. Dr. Johannes de Boer

Position: Chair Biophotonics and Medical Imaging

E-mail: j.f.de.boer@vu.nl



No agencies

We are looking for an enthusiastic candidate with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics. Would you like to work in an international research group in an academic environment? Please apply at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.


In medicine, the interest in molecular imaging has exploded in the last decade. Direct in vivo molecular imaging will become increasingly important as therapies become more specialized and molecule-specific to the disease. This requires visualizing molecular expression and molecular interaction at the cellular level and imaging in detail tissue structure and function in vivo .


The goal of the NWO-TTW Perspectief program “Medical Photonics - MEDPHOT” is to develop and validate photonics-based imaging technologies that enable earlier diagnosis and better and/or tailored treatment of diseases and translate these technologies to a clinical environment in collaborative projects with clinical opinion leaders in pulmonology, urology, and gastroenterology and industrial partners. Advanced physics concepts based on interferometry and cutting-edge technology will be developed to reach these goals.


Within the MEDPHOT program we focus on the development of hybrid optical technologies for combined structural and molecular specific imaging, including the development of novel catheters and capsules specifically optimized for combined detection. Specifically, at the VU high-end OCT systems will be developed that combine structural with targeted fluorescence imaging, i.e., an integrated immuno-OCT platform. New catheters will be designed for multifunctional imaging based on a double clad fiber design. In close collaboration with UMC Groningen (Prof. Nagengast), these catheters will be tested in pilot studies on patients. Algorithms to extract the scattering and absorbing properties of the tissues as well as the concentration of fluorescent contrast agents from the optical signals, for different tissues, will be developed. Polarization properties of tissue and materials have attracted interest in medicine and in industry. The detection of polarization changes are a prime interest, where these properties will be determined not only in tissue but also in collaboration with ASML in semiconductor materials.


Location: AMSTERDAM

FTE: 1
Job description
For this project, we are looking for a PhD student who will develop the measurements systems, develop the advanced processing algorithms for polarization properties, polarization mode dispersion and quantitative fluorescence, and perform the data analysis of in vivo human data, as well as measurements on selected wafer samples provided by ASML. The research will be conducted at the VU in Amsterdam, with regular visits to the UMC Groningen. The candidate will be part of a larger group of PhD students that collaborate closely to reach the final goals of the MEDPHOT program, and are embedded in the Biophotonics research group at the VU under supervision of Prof. Dr. J.F. de Boer.


Your duties
the PhD student will further develop probes for the esophagus, collaborate on the further design and construction of the measurement systems, and develop an excellent understanding of light propagation principles and processing methods to extract tissue information as part of the MEDPHOT program. In collaboration with ASML, the optical properties of sample wafers will be studied
the PhD student will assist in clinical pilot studies by performing the data analysis and interpretation
Requirements
For this position we are looking for an enthusiastic candidate
with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics
candidates should have good understanding of optics, have computational skills (Matlab, Labview) and be able to communicate in English both verbally and in writing. The project’s results will be presented on national and international medical and technical conferences and in relevant journals. The successful candidate is expected to write a dissertation leading to a PhD degree towards the end of the 4-year project
What are we offering?
A challenging position in a socially involved organization. On full-time basis the remuneration amounts to a minimum gross monthly salary of €2,395 (PhD) and a maximum €3,061 (PhD), depending on your education and experience. The job profile is based on the university job ranking system and is vacant for 1 FTE.


The initial employment contract will affect a period of 1 year. After a satisfactory evaluation of the initial appointment, the contract will be extended for a total duration of 4 years.


Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good work/life balance, such as:
a maximum of 41 days of annual leave based on full-time employment
8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus
solid pension scheme (ABP)
optional model for designing a personalized benefits package

About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavor – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.


Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.


Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.


The Faculty of Science

The Faculty of Science inspires researchers and students to find sustainable solutions for complex societal issues. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to medicines and from molecules to the moon: our teaching and research programmes cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. We share knowledge and experience with leading research institutes and industries, both here in the Netherlands and abroad.


Working at the Faculty of Science means working with students, PhD candidates and researchers, all with a clear focus on their field and a broad view of the world. We employ more than 1,250 staff members, and we are home to around 6,000 students.

For this project, we are looking for a PhD student who will develop the measurements systems, develop the advanced processing algorithms for polarization properties, polarization mode dispersion and quantitative fluorescence, and perform the data analysis of in vivo human data, as well as measurements on selected wafer samples provided by ASML. The research will be conducted at the VU in Amsterdam, with regular visits to the UMC Groningen. The candidate will be part of a larger group of PhD students that collaborate closely to reach the final goals of the MEDPHOT program, and are embedded in the Biophotonics research group at the VU under supervision of Prof. Dr. J.F. de Boer.


Your duties
the PhD student will further develop probes for the esophagus, collaborate on the further design and construction of the measurement systems, and develop an excellent understanding of light propagation principles and processing methods to extract tissue information as part of the MEDPHOT program. In collaboration with ASML, the optical properties of sample wafers will be studied
the PhD student will assist in clinical pilot studies by performing the data analysis and interpretation
Requirements
For this position we are looking for an enthusiastic candidate
with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics
candidates should have good understanding of optics, have computational skills (Matlab, Labview) and be able to communicate in English both verbally and in writing. The project’s results will be presented on national and international medical and technical conferences and in relevant journals. The successful candidate is expected to write a dissertation leading to a PhD degree towards the end of the 4-year project
What are we offering?
A challenging position in a socially involved organization. On full-time basis the remuneration amounts to a minimum gross monthly salary of €2,395 (PhD) and a maximum €3,061 (PhD), depending on your education and experience. The job profile is based on the university job ranking system and is vacant for 1 FTE.


The initial employment contract will affect a period of 1 year. After a satisfactory evaluation of the initial appointment, the contract will be extended for a total duration of 4 years.


Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good work/life balance, such as:
a maximum of 41 days of annual leave based on full-time employment
8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus
solid pension scheme (ABP)
optional model for designing a personalized benefits package

About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavor – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.


Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.


Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.


The Faculty of Science

The Faculty of Science inspires researchers and students to find sustainable solutions for complex societal issues. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to medicines and from molecules to the moon: our teaching and research programmes cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. We share knowledge and experience with leading research institutes and industries, both here in the Netherlands and abroad.


Working at the Faculty of Science means working with students, PhD candidates and researchers, all with a clear focus on their field and a broad view of the world. We employ more than 1,250 staff members, and we are home to around 6,000 students.


About the department of Physics and Astronomy

The Department of Physics and Astronomy at VU Amsterdam offers an active and engaged intellectual community composed of researchers from around the world. Research is focused on four themes: (i) high-energy and gravitational physics, (ii) quantum metrology and laser applications, (iii) physics of life and health, and (iv) physics of photosynthesis and energy. The department is involved in teaching in the programs Physics and Astronomy (joint degree with the University of Amsterdam), Science Business and Innovation, Medical Natural Sciences (all three BSc and MSc), and the BSc program in Mechanical Engineering (together with University of Twente). Furthermore, the department has a strong track record in valorization of its research, including translational research to the clinic (often together with the Amsterdam UMC, location VUmc (on campus) and location AMC), collaborations with industry (e.g. ARCNL), and a thriving startup scene.
Application
Are you interested in this position? Applicants are requested to respond before May, 1 2021 via the application button by uploading the following documents:
a letter in which they describe their abilities and motivation
accompanied by a detailed curriculum vitae with two or three references
a list of grades, TOEFL and/or IETLS scores (if available)
and a sample of a written report in English
The job interviews are scheduled to take place between 10 - 14 May 2021, if possible, please take them into account when applying for the position.


Applications received by e-mail will not be processed.


Vacancy questions

For additional information about this position, please contact:


Name: Prof. Dr. Johannes de Boer

Position: Chair Biophotonics and Medical Imaging

E-mail: j.f.de.boer@vu.nl



No agencies

Job Description
The Infrastructure Field Services (IFS) Technician II will provide troubleshooting, installation, testing and maintenance of various Infrastructure technologies across a diverse environment. From onsite services that include deploying IT hardware to supporting routers, switches in the IDF rooms to some telecommunications smart hands activities and data center support. You will work closely with other field technicians and engineers, ISPs, equipment vendors, and internal operations and engineering staff. Another key part of the job is in providing best of breed customer service to the supported user. Regular interaction with users along with other supporting parties will be key to the success for someone coming into this role. This role requires travel.
Scope:
Follows established procedures on routine work
Requires detailed instructions
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Assist in performing physical installation, troubleshooting, repair, maintenance, and testing activities as directed with meticulous attention to driving and maintaining the highest quality standards.
Perform physical racking of equipment (rack prep, rack and stack, switches/routers, cameras, audio visual equipment)
Run fiber, power and Ethernet cabling to specifications
Install / troubleshoot Access Point
Add or Replace disk drives and memory
Diagnose simple hardware issues
Deploy and recover laptop/desktop hardware to supported users
Support product lifecycle management activities, including asset receiving, box/unboxing of equipment, inventory put-aways and breakdown of corrugate to maintain a clean working environment
Perform inventory and asset management, conference room preventative maintenance, and e-recycling of hardware and peripherals
Organize packages coming in/out of inventory storage rooms
Location and processing of Overdue RMAs
Utilize Inventory Data management software to maintain inventory accuracy and workflow
Assist the team in recommending improvements to processes that may impact the quality of assets or improve overall efficiencies for any related process or system.
Provide site survey support for infrastructure projects, as well as large space, power, equipment and WiFi deployments.
Perform site audits and reconcile data discrepancies
Provide SmartHands with vendors working on behalf of the company to ensure compliance with installation, repair, maintenance MOPs and standards, as well as quality and cleanliness.
Meet/coordinate with Local Exchange Carrier (LEC) and other technicians to facilitate timely installation, repair, and maintenance activities as necessary.
Support a complex and fast paced environment focused on video conference rooms with outstanding attention to customer satisfaction
Assist in coordinating site access, equipment staging, and other tasks
Use ticketing systems to respond and resolve issues to specific Service Level Agreements (SLAs) & Key Performance Indicators (KPIś)
Other duties as required. This list is not meant to be a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities assigned to this position
Required Qualifications/Skills:
Associate's degree (A.A) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school and 2 to 5 years’ related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Should possess a strong understanding of enterprise level Desktop, Network, and Systems side technologies
Knowledge of data center and IDF infrastructure, including experience working with routers, switches, PDUs, interfacility cabling, fiber and copper distribution, wifi access points, telecommunications hardware, desktop computers, laptops, servers, printers and plotters.
Knowledge and application of Inventory Management as it relates to IT Logistics
Knowledge of basic AV hardware installation, support, and maintenance, specifically as it relates to conference rooms
Knowledge of telecommunications and networking testing equipment from microscopes and source and power meters to OTDRs and experience testing across all SONET and Ethernet bandwidths.
Knowledge of telecommunications testing standards and procedures from length, wire-mapping, and bit error rate to power, delay, loss, reflectance and dispersion.
Knowledge of state and local regulatory standards, procedures, and permitting requirements.
Ability to work effectively with local exchange carrier (LEC) and other telecom service provider technicians, building landlords, electricians, construction operators, and non-technical end users.
Ability to work independently, diagnose problems and take appropriate action with minimal supervision.
Experience with spreadsheets, workflow and project management applications, and administrative software applications.
Ability to lift 50 -70 pounds and the ability to un-box and move equipment for several contiguous hours days
Understanding of how to use a Tier-1 ITSM platform
Preferred Qualifications:
Customer Service Oriented
COMPTIA A+ certification
COMPTIA Network+ certification
Infrastructure & Desktop Hardware Maintenance and Troubleshooting
OS troubleshooting/support (Linux, MacOS, Windows, ChromeOS)
ITIL V3 Foundations Certification
Application of ITSM, Incident, Service Request, Problem, Change Management ticketing systems such as ServiceNow, Remedy, etc.
Detail Oriented
Strong Written and Verbal Communication
Strong Time Management
Self-Motivated
Physical Demand & Work Environment:
Must have the ability to perform office-related tasks which may include prolonged sitting or standing
Must have the ability to move from place to place within an office environment
Must be able to use a computer
Must have the ability to communicate effectively
Some positions may require occasional repetitive motion or movements of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers
What can Astreya offer you?
Employment in the fast-growing IT space providing you with a variety of career options
Opportunity to work with some of the biggest customers in the world
Introduction to new ways of working and awesome technologies
Career paths to help you establish where you want to go
Focus on internal promotion and internal mobility - we love to build teams from within
Free 24/7 accessible Professional Development through LinkedIn Learning and other online courses to give you opportunities to upskill at your own pace
Education Assistance
Dedicated management to provide you with on point leadership and care
Numerous on the job perks
Market competitive compensation and insurance, health and wellness benefits

Company Description

Astreya is the leading IT solutions provider to deliver technology-enabled services and fuel digital transformation to some of the most exciting companies on the planet. Job Description
The Infrastructure Field Services (IFS) Technician II will provide troubleshooting, installation, testing and maintenance of various Infrastructure technologies across a diverse environment. From onsite services that include deploying IT hardware to supporting routers, switches in the IDF rooms to some telecommunications smart hands activities and data center support. You will work closely with other field technicians and engineers, ISPs, equipment vendors, and internal operations and engineering staff. Another key part of the job is in providing best of breed customer service to the supported user. Regular interaction with users along with other supporting parties will be key to the success for someone coming into this role. This role requires travel.
Scope:
Follows established procedures on routine work
Requires detailed instructions
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Assist in performing physical installation, troubleshooting, repair, maintenance, and testing activities as directed with meticulous attention to driving and maintaining the highest quality standards.
Perform physical racking of equipment (rack prep, rack and stack, switches/routers, cameras, audio visual equipment)
Run fiber, power and Ethernet cabling to specifications
Install / troubleshoot Access Point
Add or Replace disk drives and memory
Diagnose simple hardware issues
Deploy and recover laptop/desktop hardware to supported users
Support product lifecycle management activities, including asset receiving, box/unboxing of equipment, inventory put-aways and breakdown of corrugate to maintain a clean working environment
Perform inventory and asset management, conference room preventative maintenance, and e-recycling of hardware and peripherals
Organize packages coming in/out of inventory storage rooms
Location and processing of Overdue RMAs
Utilize Inventory Data management software to maintain inventory accuracy and workflow
Assist the team in recommending improvements to processes that may impact the quality of assets or improve overall efficiencies for any related process or system.
Provide site survey support for infrastructure projects, as well as large space, power, equipment and WiFi deployments.
Perform site audits and reconcile data discrepancies
Provide SmartHands with vendors working on behalf of the company to ensure compliance with installation, repair, maintenance MOPs and standards, as well as quality and cleanliness.
Meet/coordinate with Local Exchange Carrier (LEC) and other technicians to facilitate timely installation, repair, and maintenance activities as necessary.
Support a complex and fast paced environment focused on video conference rooms with outstanding attention to customer satisfaction
Assist in coordinating site access, equipment staging, and other tasks
Use ticketing systems to respond and resolve issues to specific Service Level Agreements (SLAs) & Key Performance Indicators (KPIś)
Other duties as required. This list is not meant to be a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities assigned to this position

Associate's degree (A.A) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school and 2 to 5 years’ related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Should possess a strong understanding of enterprise level Desktop, Network, and Systems side technologies
Knowledge of data center and IDF infrastructure, including experience working with routers, switches, PDUs, interfacility cabling, fiber and copper distribution, wifi access points, telecommunications hardware, desktop computers, laptops, servers, printers and plotters.
Knowledge and application of Inventory Management as it relates to IT Logistics
Knowledge of basic AV hardware installation, support, and maintenance, specifically as it relates to conference rooms
Knowledge of telecommunications and networking testing equipment from microscopes and source and power meters to OTDRs and experience testing across all SONET and Ethernet bandwidths.
Knowledge of telecommunications testing standards and procedures from length, wire-mapping, and bit error rate to power, delay, loss, reflectance and dispersion.
Knowledge of state and local regulatory standards, procedures, and permitting requirements.
Ability to work effectively with local exchange carrier (LEC) and other telecom service provider technicians, building landlords, electricians, construction operators, and non-technical end users.
Ability to work independently, diagnose problems and take appropriate action with minimal supervision.
Experience with spreadsheets, workflow and project management applications, and administrative software applications.
Ability to lift 50 -70 pounds and the ability to un-box and move equipment for several contiguous hours days
Understanding of how to use a Tier-1 ITSM platform

COMPTIA A+ certification
COMPTIA Network+ certification
Infrastructure & Desktop Hardware Maintenance and Troubleshooting
OS troubleshooting/support (Linux, MacOS, Windows, ChromeOS)
