Do you want to join our team as our new Senior Interior Designer? Then we'd love to hear about you!

We are looking for an enthusiastic candidate with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics. Would you like to work in an international research group in an academic environment? Please apply at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.


In medicine, the interest in molecular imaging has exploded in the last decade. Direct in vivo molecular imaging will become increasingly important as therapies become more specialized and molecule-specific to the disease. This requires visualizing molecular expression and molecular interaction at the cellular level and imaging in detail tissue structure and function in vivo .


The goal of the NWO-TTW Perspectief program “Medical Photonics - MEDPHOT” is to develop and validate photonics-based imaging technologies that enable earlier diagnosis and better and/or tailored treatment of diseases and translate these technologies to a clinical environment in collaborative projects with clinical opinion leaders in pulmonology, urology, and gastroenterology and industrial partners. Advanced physics concepts based on interferometry and cutting-edge technology will be developed to reach these goals.


Within the MEDPHOT program we focus on the development of hybrid optical technologies for combined structural and molecular specific imaging, including the development of novel catheters and capsules specifically optimized for combined detection. Specifically, at the VU high-end OCT systems will be developed that combine structural with targeted fluorescence imaging, i.e., an integrated immuno-OCT platform. New catheters will be designed for multifunctional imaging based on a double clad fiber design. In close collaboration with UMC Groningen (Prof. Nagengast), these catheters will be tested in pilot studies on patients. Algorithms to extract the scattering and absorbing properties of the tissues as well as the concentration of fluorescent contrast agents from the optical signals, for different tissues, will be developed. Polarization properties of tissue and materials have attracted interest in medicine and in industry. The detection of polarization changes are a prime interest, where these properties will be determined not only in tissue but also in collaboration with ASML in semiconductor materials.


Location: AMSTERDAM

FTE: 1
Job description
For this project, we are looking for a PhD student who will develop the measurements systems, develop the advanced processing algorithms for polarization properties, polarization mode dispersion and quantitative fluorescence, and perform the data analysis of in vivo human data, as well as measurements on selected wafer samples provided by ASML. The research will be conducted at the VU in Amsterdam, with regular visits to the UMC Groningen. The candidate will be part of a larger group of PhD students that collaborate closely to reach the final goals of the MEDPHOT program, and are embedded in the Biophotonics research group at the VU under supervision of Prof. Dr. J.F. de Boer.


Your duties
the PhD student will further develop probes for the esophagus, collaborate on the further design and construction of the measurement systems, and develop an excellent understanding of light propagation principles and processing methods to extract tissue information as part of the MEDPHOT program. In collaboration with ASML, the optical properties of sample wafers will be studied
the PhD student will assist in clinical pilot studies by performing the data analysis and interpretation
Requirements
For this position we are looking for an enthusiastic candidate
with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics
candidates should have good understanding of optics, have computational skills (Matlab, Labview) and be able to communicate in English both verbally and in writing. The project’s results will be presented on national and international medical and technical conferences and in relevant journals. The successful candidate is expected to write a dissertation leading to a PhD degree towards the end of the 4-year project
What are we offering?
A challenging position in a socially involved organization. On full-time basis the remuneration amounts to a minimum gross monthly salary of €2,395 (PhD) and a maximum €3,061 (PhD), depending on your education and experience. The job profile is based on the university job ranking system and is vacant for 1 FTE.


The initial employment contract will affect a period of 1 year. After a satisfactory evaluation of the initial appointment, the contract will be extended for a total duration of 4 years.


Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good work/life balance, such as:
a maximum of 41 days of annual leave based on full-time employment
8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus
solid pension scheme (ABP)
optional model for designing a personalized benefits package

About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavor – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.


Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.


Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.


The Faculty of Science

The Faculty of Science inspires researchers and students to find sustainable solutions for complex societal issues. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to medicines and from molecules to the moon: our teaching and research programmes cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. We share knowledge and experience with leading research institutes and industries, both here in the Netherlands and abroad.


Working at the Faculty of Science means working with students, PhD candidates and researchers, all with a clear focus on their field and a broad view of the world. We employ more than 1,250 staff members, and we are home to around 6,000 students.


About the department of Physics and Astronomy

The Department of Physics and Astronomy at VU Amsterdam offers an active and engaged intellectual community composed of researchers from around the world. Research is focused on four themes: (i) high-energy and gravitational physics, (ii) quantum metrology and laser applications, (iii) physics of life and health, and (iv) physics of photosynthesis and energy. The department is involved in teaching in the programs Physics and Astronomy (joint degree with the University of Amsterdam), Science Business and Innovation, Medical Natural Sciences (all three BSc and MSc), and the BSc program in Mechanical Engineering (together with University of Twente). Furthermore, the department has a strong track record in valorization of its research, including translational research to the clinic (often together with the Amsterdam UMC, location VUmc (on campus) and location AMC), collaborations with industry (e.g. ARCNL), and a thriving startup scene.
Application
Are you interested in this position? Applicants are requested to respond before May, 1 2021 via the application button by uploading the following documents:
a letter in which they describe their abilities and motivation
accompanied by a detailed curriculum vitae with two or three references
a list of grades, TOEFL and/or IETLS scores (if available)
and a sample of a written report in English
The job interviews are scheduled to take place between 10 - 14 May 2021, if possible, please take them into account when applying for the position.


Applications received by e-mail will not be processed.


Vacancy questions

For additional information about this position, please contact:

New catheters will be designed for multifunctional imaging based on a double clad fiber design. In close collaboration with UMC Groningen (Prof. Nagengast), these catheters will be tested in pilot studies on patients. Algorithms to extract the scattering and absorbing properties of the tissues as well as the concentration of fluorescent contrast agents from the optical signals, for different tissues, will be developed. Polarization properties of tissue and materials have attracted interest in medicine and in industry. The detection of polarization changes are a prime interest, where these properties will be determined not only in tissue but also in collaboration with ASML in semiconductor materials.


Location: AMSTERDAM

FTE: 1
Job description
For this project, we are looking for a PhD student who will develop the measurements systems, develop the advanced processing algorithms for polarization properties, polarization mode dispersion and quantitative fluorescence, and perform the data analysis of in vivo human data, as well as measurements on selected wafer samples provided by ASML. The research will be conducted at the VU in Amsterdam, with regular visits to the UMC Groningen. The candidate will be part of a larger group of PhD students that collaborate closely to reach the final goals of the MEDPHOT program, and are embedded in the Biophotonics research group at the VU under supervision of Prof. Dr. J.F. de Boer.


Your duties
the PhD student will further develop probes for the esophagus, collaborate on the further design and construction of the measurement systems, and develop an excellent understanding of light propagation principles and processing methods to extract tissue information as part of the MEDPHOT program. In collaboration with ASML, the optical properties of sample wafers will be studied
the PhD student will assist in clinical pilot studies by performing the data analysis and interpretation
Requirements
For this position we are looking for an enthusiastic candidate
with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics
candidates should have good understanding of optics, have computational skills (Matlab, Labview) and be able to communicate in English both verbally and in writing. The project’s results will be presented on national and international medical and technical conferences and in relevant journals. The successful candidate is expected to write a dissertation leading to a PhD degree towards the end of the 4-year project
What are we offering?
A challenging position in a socially involved organization. On full-time basis the remuneration amounts to a minimum gross monthly salary of €2,395 (PhD) and a maximum €3,061 (PhD), depending on your education and experience. The job profile is based on the university job ranking system and is vacant for 1 FTE.


The initial employment contract will affect a period of 1 year. After a satisfactory evaluation of the initial appointment, the contract will be extended for a total duration of 4 years.


Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good work/life balance, such as:
a maximum of 41 days of annual leave based on full-time employment
8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus
solid pension scheme (ABP)
optional model for designing a personalized benefits package

About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavor – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.


Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.


Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.


The Faculty of Science

The Faculty of Science inspires researchers and students to find sustainable solutions for complex societal issues. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to medicines and from molecules to the moon: our teaching and research programmes cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. We share knowledge and experience with leading research institutes and industries, both here in the Netherlands and abroad.


Working at the Faculty of Science means working with students, PhD candidates and researchers, all with a clear focus on their field and a broad view of the world. We employ more than 1,250 staff members, and we are home to around 6,000 students.


About the department of Physics and Astronomy

The Department of Physics and Astronomy at VU Amsterdam offers an active and engaged intellectual community composed of researchers from around the world. Research is focused on four themes: (i) high-energy and gravitational physics, (ii) quantum metrology and laser applications, (iii) physics of life and health, and (iv) physics of photosynthesis and energy. The department is involved in teaching in the programs Physics and Astronomy (joint degree with the University of Amsterdam), Science Business and Innovation, Medical Natural Sciences (all three BSc and MSc), and the BSc program in Mechanical Engineering (together with University of Twente). Furthermore, the department has a strong track record in valorization of its research, including translational research to the clinic (often together with the Amsterdam UMC, location VUmc (on campus) and location AMC), collaborations with industry (e.g. ARCNL), and a thriving startup scene.
Application
Are you interested in this position? Applicants are requested to respond before May, 1 2021 via the application button by uploading the following documents:
a letter in which they describe their abilities and motivation
accompanied by a detailed curriculum vitae with two or three references
a list of grades, TOEFL and/or IETLS scores (if available)
and a sample of a written report in English
The job interviews are scheduled to take place between 10 - 14 May 2021, if possible, please take them into account when applying for the position.


Applications received by e-mail will not be processed.

Polarization properties of tissue and materials have attracted interest in medicine and in industry. The detection of polarization changes are a prime interest, where these properties will be determined not only in tissue but also in collaboration with ASML in semiconductor materials.

Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.


Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.


The Faculty of Science

The Faculty of Science inspires researchers and students to find sustainable solutions for complex societal issues. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to medicines and from molecules to the moon: our teaching and research programmes cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. We share knowledge and experience with leading research institutes and industries, both here in the Netherlands and abroad.


Working at the Faculty of Science means working with students, PhD candidates and researchers, all with a clear focus on their field and a broad view of the world. We employ more than 1,250 staff members, and we are home to around 6,000 students.


About the department of Physics and Astronomy

The Department of Physics and Astronomy at VU Amsterdam offers an active and engaged intellectual community composed of researchers from around the world. Research is focused on four themes: (i) high-energy and gravitational physics, (ii) quantum metrology and laser applications, (iii) physics of life and health, and (iv) physics of photosynthesis and energy. The department is involved in teaching in the programs Physics and Astronomy (joint degree with the University of Amsterdam), Science Business and Innovation, Medical Natural Sciences (all three BSc and MSc), and the BSc program in Mechanical Engineering (together with University of Twente). Furthermore, the department has a strong track record in valorization of its research, including translational research to the clinic (often together with the Amsterdam UMC, location VUmc (on campus) and location AMC), collaborations with industry (e.g. ARCNL), and a thriving startup scene.
Application
Are you interested in this position? Applicants are requested to respond before May, 1 2021 via the application button by uploading the following documents:
a letter in which they describe their abilities and motivation
accompanied by a detailed curriculum vitae with two or three references
a list of grades, TOEFL and/or IETLS scores (if available)
and a sample of a written report in English
The job interviews are scheduled to take place between 10 - 14 May 2021, if possible, please take them into account when applying for the position.


Applications received by e-mail will not be processed.


Vacancy questions

For additional information about this position, please contact:


Name: Prof. Dr. Johannes de Boer

Position: Chair Biophotonics and Medical Imaging

E-mail: j.f.de.boer@vu.nl



No agencies

Company Description

Astreya is the leading IT solutions provider to deliver technology-enabled services and fuel digital transformation to some of the most exciting companies on the planet. We are at the cusp of a new way of working with our delivery model that helps our clients be positively productive by matching exceptional people to on-site teams delivering world-class IT service. With engineers in over 30 countries and 70 cities around the world, we are a global company working with the world's most recognizable and innovative organizations.

Job Description
The Infrastructure Field Services (IFS) Technician II will provide troubleshooting, installation, testing and maintenance of various Infrastructure technologies across a diverse environment. From onsite services that include deploying IT hardware to supporting routers, switches in the IDF rooms to some telecommunications smart hands activities and data center support. You will work closely with other field technicians and engineers, ISPs, equipment vendors, and internal operations and engineering staff. Another key part of the job is in providing best of breed customer service to the supported user. Regular interaction with users along with other supporting parties will be key to the success for someone coming into this role. This role requires travel.
Scope:
Follows established procedures on routine work
Requires detailed instructions
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Assist in performing physical installation, troubleshooting, repair, maintenance, and testing activities as directed with meticulous attention to driving and maintaining the highest quality standards.
Perform physical racking of equipment (rack prep, rack and stack, switches/routers, cameras, audio visual equipment)
Run fiber, power and Ethernet cabling to specifications
Install / troubleshoot Access Point
Add or Replace disk drives and memory
Diagnose simple hardware issues
Deploy and recover laptop/desktop hardware to supported users
Support product lifecycle management activities, including asset receiving, box/unboxing of equipment, inventory put-aways and breakdown of corrugate to maintain a clean working environment
Perform inventory and asset management, conference room preventative maintenance, and e-recycling of hardware and peripherals
Organize packages coming in/out of inventory storage rooms
Location and processing of Overdue RMAs
Utilize Inventory Data management software to maintain inventory accuracy and workflow
Assist the team in recommending improvements to processes that may impact the quality of assets or improve overall efficiencies for any related process or system.
Provide site survey support for infrastructure projects, as well as large space, power, equipment and WiFi deployments.
Perform site audits and reconcile data discrepancies
Provide SmartHands with vendors working on behalf of the company to ensure compliance with installation, repair, maintenance MOPs and standards, as well as quality and cleanliness.
Meet/coordinate with Local Exchange Carrier (LEC) and other technicians to facilitate timely installation, repair, and maintenance activities as necessary.
Support a complex and fast paced environment focused on video conference rooms with outstanding attention to customer satisfaction
Assist in coordinating site access, equipment staging, and other tasks
Use ticketing systems to respond and resolve issues to specific Service Level Agreements (SLAs) & Key Performance Indicators (KPIś)
Other duties as required. This list is not meant to be a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities assigned to this position
Required Qualifications/Skills:
Associate's degree (A.A) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school and 2 to 5 years’ related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Should possess a strong understanding of enterprise level Desktop, Network, and Systems side technologies
Knowledge of data center and IDF infrastructure, including experience working with routers, switches, PDUs, interfacility cabling, fiber and copper distribution, wifi access points, telecommunications hardware, desktop computers, laptops, servers, printers and plotters.
Knowledge and application of Inventory Management as it relates to IT Logistics
Knowledge of basic AV hardware installation, support, and maintenance, specifically as it relates to conference rooms
Knowledge of telecommunications and networking testing equipment from microscopes and source and power meters to OTDRs and experience testing across all SONET and Ethernet bandwidths.
Knowledge of telecommunications testing standards and procedures from length, wire-mapping, and bit error rate to power, delay, loss, reflectance and dispersion.
Knowledge of state and local regulatory standards, procedures, and permitting requirements.
Ability to work effectively with local exchange carrier (LEC) and other telecom service provider technicians, building landlords, electricians, construction operators, and non-technical end users.
Ability to work independently, diagnose problems and take appropriate action with minimal supervision.
Experience with spreadsheets, workflow and project management applications, and administrative software applications.
Ability to lift 50 -70 pounds and the ability to un-box and move equipment for several contiguous hours days
Understanding of how to use a Tier-1 ITSM platform
Preferred Qualifications:
Customer Service Oriented
COMPTIA A+ certification
COMPTIA Network+ certification
Infrastructure & Desktop Hardware Maintenance and Troubleshooting
OS troubleshooting/support (Linux, MacOS, Windows, ChromeOS)
ITIL V3 Foundations Certification
Application of ITSM, Incident, Service Request, Problem, Change Management ticketing systems such as ServiceNow, Remedy, etc.
Detail Oriented
Strong Written and Verbal Communication
Strong Time Management
Self-Motivated
Physical Demand & Work Environment:
Must have the ability to perform office-related tasks which may include prolonged sitting or standing
Must have the ability to move from place to place within an office environment
Must be able to use a computer
Must have the ability to communicate effectively
Some positions may require occasional repetitive motion or movements of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers
What can Astreya offer you?
Employment in the fast-growing IT space providing you with a variety of career options
Opportunity to work with some of the biggest customers in the world
Introduction to new ways of working and awesome technologies
Career paths to help you establish where you want to go
Focus on internal promotion and internal mobility - we love to build teams from within
Free 24/7 accessible Professional Development through LinkedIn Learning and other online courses to give you opportunities to upskill at your own pace
Education Assistance
Dedicated management to provide you with on point leadership and care
Numerous on the job perks
Market competitive compensation and insurance, health and wellness benefits

Additional Information
Astreya Partners is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. We evaluate qualified applicants on merit and business needs and not on race, color, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status or any other factor protected by law.

Company Description

Astreya is the leading IT solutions provider to deliver technology-enabled services and fuel digital transformation to some of the most exciting companies on the planet. We are at the cusp of a new way of working with our delivery model that helps our clients be positively productive by matching exceptional people to on-site teams delivering world-class IT service. With engineers in over 30 countries and 70 cities around the world, we are a global company working with the world's most recognizable and innovative organizations.

Job Description
The Infrastructure Field Services (IFS) Technician II will provide troubleshooting, installation, testing and maintenance of various Infrastructure technologies across a diverse environment. From onsite services that include deploying IT hardware to supporting routers, switches in the IDF rooms to some telecommunications smart hands activities and data center support. You will work closely with other field technicians and engineers, ISPs, equipment vendors, and internal operations and engineering staff. Another key part of the job is in providing best of breed customer service to the supported user. Regular interaction with users along with other supporting parties will be key to the success for someone coming into this role. This role requires travel.
Scope:
Follows established procedures on routine work
Requires detailed instructions
Your Roles and Responsibilities:
Assist in performing physical installation, troubleshooting, repair, maintenance, and testing activities as directed with meticulous attention to driving and maintaining the highest quality standards.
Perform physical racking of equipment (rack prep, rack and stack, switches/routers, cameras, audio visual equipment)
Run fiber, power and Ethernet cabling to specifications
Install / troubleshoot Access Point
Add or Replace disk drives and memory
Diagnose simple hardware issues
Deploy and recover laptop/desktop hardware to supported users
Support product lifecycle management activities, including asset receiving, box/unboxing of equipment, inventory put-aways and breakdown of corrugate to maintain a clean working environment
Perform inventory and asset management, conference room preventative maintenance, and e-recycling of hardware and peripherals
Organize packages coming in/out of inventory storage rooms
Location and processing of Overdue RMAs
Utilize Inventory Data management software to maintain inventory accuracy and workflow
Assist the team in recommending improvements to processes that may impact the quality of assets or improve overall efficiencies for any related process or system.
Provide site survey support for infrastructure projects, as well as large space, power, equipment and WiFi deployments.
Perform site audits and reconcile data discrepancies
Provide SmartHands with vendors working on behalf of the company to ensure compliance with installation, repair, maintenance MOPs and standards, as well as quality and cleanliness.
Meet/coordinate with Local Exchange Carrier (LEC) and other technicians to facilitate timely installation, repair, and maintenance activities as necessary.
Support a complex and fast paced environment focused on video conference rooms with outstanding attention to customer satisfaction
Assist in coordinating site access, equipment staging, and other tasks
Use ticketing systems to respond and resolve issues to specific Service Level Agreements (SLAs) & Key Performance Indicators (KPIś)
Other duties as required. This list is not meant to be a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities assigned to this position
Required Qualifications/Skills:
Associate's degree (A.A) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school and 2 to 5 years’ related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Should possess a strong understanding of enterprise level Desktop, Network, and Systems side technologies
Knowledge of data center and IDF infrastructure, including experience working with routers, switches, PDUs, interfacility cabling, fiber and copper distribution, wifi access points, telecommunications hardware, desktop computers, laptops, servers, printers and plotters.
Knowledge and application of Inventory Management as it relates to IT Logistics
Knowledge of basic AV hardware installation, support, and maintenance, specifically as it relates to conference rooms
Knowledge of telecommunications and networking testing equipment from microscopes and source and power meters to OTDRs and experience testing across all SONET and Ethernet bandwidths.
Knowledge of telecommunications testing standards and procedures from length, wire-mapping, and bit error rate to power, delay, loss, reflectance and dispersion.
Knowledge of state and local regulatory standards, procedures, and permitting requirements.
Ability to work effectively with local exchange carrier (LEC) and other telecom service provider technicians, building landlords, electricians, construction operators, and non-technical end users.
Ability to work independently, diagnose problems and take appropriate action with minimal supervision.
Experience with spreadsheets, workflow and project management applications, and administrative software applications.
Ability to lift 50 -70 pounds and the ability to un-box and move equipment for several contiguous hours days
Understanding of how to use a Tier-1 ITSM platform
Preferred Qualifications:
Customer Service Oriented
COMPTIA A+ certification
COMPTIA Network+ certification
Infrastructure & Desktop Hardware Maintenance and Troubleshooting
OS troubleshooting/support (Linux, MacOS, Windows, ChromeOS)
ITIL V3 Foundations Certification
Application of ITSM, Incident, Service Request, Problem, Change Management ticketing systems such as ServiceNow, Remedy, etc.
Detail Oriented
Strong Written and Verbal Communication
Strong Time Management
Self-Motivated
Physical Demand & Work Environment:
Must have the ability to perform office-related tasks which may include prolonged sitting or standing
Must have the ability to move from place to place within an office environment
Must be able to use a computer
Must have the ability to communicate effectively
Some positions may require occasional repetitive motion or movements of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers

Employment in the fast-growing IT space providing you with a variety of career options
Opportunity to work with some of the biggest customers in the world
Introduction to new ways of working and awesome technologies

Job Title: IT Solution Architect | APG - Flexible, Europe
Job Description:
Country: Netherlands
City: Amsterdam
273519
About CRH
CRH is the leading global diversified building materials business in the world with over 3,100 locations worldwide. We manufacture and supply a diverse range of superior building materials and products, used extensively in the built environment, in infrastructure, housing and commercial construction projects, of all sizes, all across the world.
To find out more, visit our website www.crh.com.
Position Overview
We are looking for a talented and suitable qualified individual to join our centralised IT department as a Solution Architect based in our corporate offices in Amsterdam or our local business offices in Europe.
In this role, you will proactively and holistically lead and support the development and implementation of a portfolio of technology solutions for APG Europe.

The Solution Architect requires a clear understanding of business goals, objectives, value-streams, outcomes, capabilities, and processes and will provide the necessary leadership, analysis and design acumen to support the development of technology solutions that meet business needs that align with APG standards and principles. As well as will act as part of the Design Authority and manages the transformation of many processes that will require business process reengineering and extensive stakeholder management.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
Translate Business Strategy into Solutions Architecture
Work with the appropriate business SMEs and project teams to review and understand the business’ expectations, evaluate requirements and propose options.
Recommend business process changes by identifying opportunities that can be enabled with new or better-aligned technology solutions
Build collaborative relationships across APG to facilitate change and technology adoption
Technical Solutions Analysis and Design
Determine operational objectives by studying business functions and current practices; gathering information, evaluating processes and output requirements
Create reference architectures focused on defined APG principles and technology strategies

Design new systems and applications by analysing requirements; documenting solution architectures; defining new system capabilities and integrations; writing specifications.
Understand and simplify systems inter-dependencies by leveraging standard integrations and APIs
Maintain user confidence by protecting and enhancing current business capabilities and operations
Delivery of Solutions & Business Outcomes
Develop a roadmap for the evolution of APG Europe’s application portfolio and reference architecture, including buy versus build options and the sequencing of initiatives
Participate in system delivery projects by providing expertise and hands-on input as necessary
Monitor project progress by tracking activities; resolving risks/issues; recommending actions
Assist in identifying organisational and business process change actions
Key competencies and relevant experience
To be successful in this role you will need to be educated to bachelor or master’s degree level and possess previous Solution Architect or similar experience ideally gained within an international IT setting.

You will be a well-rounded professional with sound business acumen. Experienced in working within a large, multifaceted organisation, consisting of cross-functional teams with good knowledge of various aspects of application architecture definition in terms of structure, dependencies and the mapping to business capabilities/processes.
Specific Requirements;
Ability to develop and prepare business cases, functional specifications and technical requirements
Process re-engineering and optimisation skills, Six Sigma certification desirable
Good understanding of product management, agile & DevOps principles
Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills - Ability to effectively work and communicate with people with a wide range of skills, cultures and capabilities.
Demonstrated commitment toward customer service.
Experience with scalable, sustainable, global ERP systems in the manufacturing industry (such as SAP, Infor, Dynamics, Oracle, NetSuite, Softlab)
Experience with SCM modules and Logistics - Desirable
Working knowledge of modelling languages (UML, etc.) - Desirable
What CRH Offers You
Highly competitive terms and conditions (including but not just basic and performance-related pay)
Health, wellness and safety programs
Excellent opportunities to develop and progress with a global organisation
CRH is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Ben jij bekend met de basisprincipes van elektriciteit en ben je commercieel ingesteld? Dan is dit de vacature voor jou! Voor een mooie organisatie zijn wij op zoek naar een Accountmanager.

Als Accountmanager is het jouw missie om de producten en dienstverlening op de kaart te zetten
Je vertrekt vanuit de bestaande klantenportefeuille en neemt de leiding in de opstart, het bekend maken en verkopen van de professionele laadsystemen voor hybride en elektrische wagens voor privé-en bedrijfsgebruik.
Je legt contacten binnen de sector van Facilities - Construction en Fleet-Lease. Je brengt de markt in kaart, analyseert huidige en toekomstige behoeften en commerciële opportuniteiten. Je initieert de nodige acties om oplossingen "top-of-mind" te maken.
Je bent de directe contactpersoon voor je klanten, staat steeds tot hun dienst en plant regelmatige bezoeken met het oog op het uitbouwen van een lange relatie.
Je neemt initiatief en prospecteert actief (koud), plant klantenbezoeken, presenteert (nieuwe) producten en geeft het gepaste advies, je leidt de klant naar het juiste commerciële voorstel en finaal sluit je de contracten af.
Je structureert en organiseert je agenda, klanteninformatie en beheert de administratieve opvolging van de verkoop.
Je behaalt de vooropgestelde verkoopresultaten.
Wekelijks overleg je jouw resultaat met de salesmanager en de product manager laadoplossingen, je evalueert en bepaalt de strategie voor het aanpakken van de markt en zorgt voor nieuwe oplossingen gebaseerd op deze permanente evaluaties.

Waar ga je werken?
Een internationale organisatie actief in de montagesystemen van zonnepanelen. 1x per week werk je vanuit Deventer en verder ben je in de buitendienst actief in heel Nederland.

Wat vragen wij?
Je hebt een degelijke kennis van de basisprincipes van elektriciteit.
Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in vergelijkbare sales functies, kennis van de sector van de duurzame energie is een pluspunt.

De klant komt bij jou altijd op de eerste plaats, je bent steeds bereikbaar.
Je hebt zin in het aangaan van de uitdagingen binnen een innovatieve en snel evoluerende markt. Je ontwikkelt continu jezelf en je marktkennis.
Je neemt initiatief, je bent actief, onafhankelijk, positief assertief en resultaatgericht.
Je bent vlot, sociaal in de omgang, beleefd en hebt een verzorgd voorkomen.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve en commerciële vaardigheden ("openen van deuren", analyse van de noden van de klant...)

Je bent in het bezit van een rijbewijs.

Vragen? Dit kan via robert.ouwehand@adecco.nl

Ben jij bekend met de basisprincipes van elektriciteit en ben je commercieel ingesteld? Dan is dit de vacature voor jou! Voor een mooie organisatie zijn wij op zoek naar een Accountmanager.

Als Accountmanager is het jouw missie om de producten en dienstverlening op de kaart te zetten
Je vertrekt vanuit de bestaande klantenportefeuille en neemt de leiding in de opstart, het bekend maken en verkopen van de professionele laadsystemen voor hybride en elektrische wagens voor privé-en bedrijfsgebruik.
Je legt contacten binnen de sector van Facilities - Construction en Fleet-Lease. Je brengt de markt in kaart, analyseert huidige en toekomstige behoeften en commerciële opportuniteiten. Je initieert de nodige acties om oplossingen "top-of-mind" te maken.
Je bent de directe contactpersoon voor je klanten, staat steeds tot hun dienst en plant regelmatige bezoeken met het oog op het uitbouwen van een lange relatie.
Je neemt initiatief en prospecteert actief (koud), plant klantenbezoeken, presenteert (nieuwe) producten en geeft het gepaste advies, je leidt de klant naar het juiste commerciële voorstel en finaal sluit je de contracten af.
Je structureert en organiseert je agenda, klanteninformatie en beheert de administratieve opvolging van de verkoop.
Je behaalt de vooropgestelde verkoopresultaten.
Wekelijks overleg je jouw resultaat met de salesmanager en de product manager laadoplossingen, je evalueert en bepaalt de strategie voor het aanpakken van de markt en zorgt voor nieuwe oplossingen gebaseerd op deze permanente evaluaties.

Waar ga je werken?
Een internationale organisatie actief in de montagesystemen van zonnepanelen. 1x per week werk je vanuit Deventer en verder ben je in de buitendienst actief in heel Nederland.

Wat vragen wij?
Je hebt een degelijke kennis van de basisprincipes van elektriciteit.
Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in vergelijkbare sales functies, kennis van de sector van de duurzame energie is een pluspunt.

De klant komt bij jou altijd op de eerste plaats, je bent steeds bereikbaar.
Je hebt zin in het aangaan van de uitdagingen binnen een innovatieve en snel evoluerende markt. Je ontwikkelt continu jezelf en je marktkennis.
Je neemt initiatief, je bent actief, onafhankelijk, positief assertief en resultaatgericht.
Je bent vlot, sociaal in de omgang, beleefd en hebt een verzorgd voorkomen.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve en commerciële vaardigheden ("openen van deuren", analyse van de noden van de klant...)

Je bent in het bezit van een rijbewijs.

Vragen? Dit kan via robert.ouwehand@adecco.nl

Vacancy: Senior Scala Developer Maarssen

Would you like to work for one of the leading E-Health tech companies here in the Netherland?
Do you enjoy working in an environment where you can have a lot of impact with systems that almost every person in the NL, can benefit from and even save lives?
Do you like many new construction issues that are developed with technologies such as: Scala, Akka HTTP / Streams, Kafka, Cats, Kubernetes, Docker, CQRS, AWS and Elasticsearch?

Don't wait any longer, we have the job for you!

Your employer: Leading E-Health Tech company knows how to surprise time and again with innovation

Ever since its foundation, decades ago, this medium-sized tech company has been a leader in the development of mission-critical E-Health solutions. 90% of primary care and all hospitals in the Netherlands depend on the products of this tech company. So you can say that people are making a huge positive impact here every day.

Through continuous innovation, people are able to raise the bar again and again and take healthcare in the Netherlands to a higher level. A completely new platform will be developed that will make a major contribution to the influence that we as a patient have on our care. So no longer dependent on choices of others, but also determine yourself about the care you receive. This will completely change the way we receive care in the Netherlands. In a positive sense then! This new platform has a lot of complex challenges, including scaling, which must be available to 17 million people in the Netherlands. You can work here with a nicemodern tech stack that includes Scala, Akka HTTP / Streams, Kafka, Cats, Kubernetes, Docker, CQRS, AWS and Elasticsearch.

All this has resulted in you working here in a proud and ambitious working environment with a high software engineering level. Yet people here have remained very informal, down to earth and the working atmosphere is therefore very relaxed with an excellent work-life balance. You will find a lot of flexibility here such as home working days, flexible times. There is enough room here for personal development and the disciplines here are divided over Squads, which together look at how organizations can continue to innovate broadly.

Does this sound like something to you?

Your role: Senior Scala developer Maarssen

In your role as Senior Scala Developer Maarssen you will work in one of the most innovative teams within the organization. Because new products are being developed here, you have a lot of greenfield and the amount of legacy code is limited to the minimum. The team is end to end responsible for its own product. You build it, you run it. You and your team of experienced Scala Developers are going to build a new product that will form a very important part of a mission-critical chain within healthcare. The challenge here is that it is a chain with very complex processes, within a very complex domain. The challenge is to automate this with software engineering best practices such as clean coding. If you like complex puzzles, then you've come to the right place.

What is being asked?
BSc or MSc Computer Science or comparable level
Minimum 5 years of professional Software Development experience
Experience with Scala from own project, professional or Coursera course
Experience with Akka HTTP/Stream and/or Cats is a plus
Experience with Kafka and / or Kubernetes is an advantage
Experience with Docker and / or CQRS is an advantage
Experience with NoSQL technology is a plus
Experience with AWS is an advantage
Experience with Logstash and / or Gatling is an advantage
Experience with Continuous delivery and deployment is a plus
Experience with Automated Testing is a plus
What is offered?
Salary between € 70.000 and € 85.000 per year
2-3 days working from home
25 vacation days, but free extra days if you need more :-)
pension plan
Very flexible working hours
The best hardware
Travel allowance
Own parking space
Catered meals during the day
Would you like to work as a Senior Scala Developer Maarssen and to have an impact on the future of how we structure healthcare in the Netherlands and you can combine this in a technically challenging environment?
Respond now and send your resume to Serge Warbout via s.warbout@codeguild.nl or respond using the form below.

Wekelijks overleg je jouw resultaat met de salesmanager en de product manager laadoplossingen, je evalueert en bepaalt de strategie voor het aanpakken van de markt en zorgt voor nieuwe oplossingen gebaseerd op deze permanente evaluaties.

Waar ga je werken?
Een internationale organisatie actief in de montagesystemen van zonnepanelen. 1x per week werk je vanuit Deventer en verder ben je in de buitendienst actief in heel Nederland.

Wat vragen wij?
Je hebt een degelijke kennis van de basisprincipes van elektriciteit.
Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in vergelijkbare sales functies, kennis van de sector van de duurzame energie is een pluspunt.

De klant komt bij jou altijd op de eerste plaats, je bent steeds bereikbaar.
Je hebt zin in het aangaan van de uitdagingen binnen een innovatieve en snel evoluerende markt. Je ontwikkelt continu jezelf en je marktkennis.
Je neemt initiatief, je bent actief, onafhankelijk, positief assertief en resultaatgericht.
Je bent vlot, sociaal in de omgang, beleefd en hebt een verzorgd voorkomen.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve en commerciële vaardigheden ("openen van deuren", analyse van de noden van de klant...)

Je bent in het bezit van een rijbewijs.

Vragen? Dit kan via robert.ouwehand@adecco.nl

Ben jij bekend met de basisprincipes van elektriciteit en ben je commercieel ingesteld? Dan is dit de vacature voor jou! Voor een mooie organisatie zijn wij op zoek naar een Accountmanager.

Als Accountmanager is het jouw missie om de producten en dienstverlening op de kaart te zetten
Je vertrekt vanuit de bestaande klantenportefeuille en neemt de leiding in de opstart, het bekend maken en verkopen van de professionele laadsystemen voor hybride en elektrische wagens voor privé-en bedrijfsgebruik.
Je legt contacten binnen de sector van Facilities - Construction en Fleet-Lease. Je brengt de markt in kaart, analyseert huidige en toekomstige behoeften en commerciële opportuniteiten. Je initieert de nodige acties om oplossingen "top-of-mind" te maken.
Je bent de directe contactpersoon voor je klanten, staat steeds tot hun dienst en plant regelmatige bezoeken met het oog op het uitbouwen van een lange relatie.
Je neemt initiatief en prospecteert actief (koud), plant klantenbezoeken, presenteert (nieuwe) producten en geeft het gepaste advies, je leidt de klant naar het juiste commerciële voorstel en finaal sluit je de contracten af.
Je structureert en organiseert je agenda, klanteninformatie en beheert de administratieve opvolging van de verkoop.
Je behaalt de vooropgestelde verkoopresultaten.

Job Title: IT Business Process Expert - Manufacturing & Quality - Flexible - Europe
Job Description:
Job ID: 273259
Leviat, a CRH company, is a global leader in insulating, lifting, anchoring, and connecting technology for the construction industry. Leviat’s engineered products and innovative construction solutions are used in a variety of market segments from residential to infrastructure, enabling users to build better, stronger, safer, and faster. The company employs nearly 3,000 people at 60 locations globally. Leviat’s suite of trusted product brands include Meadow Burke, Halfen, and Thermomass.
About Leviat
Leviat is a world leader in connecting, fixing, lifting and anchoring technology for the construction industry. Our trusted product brands, including Ancon, HALFEN, Plaka and Meadow Burke, are all known for high performance, quality and reliability. These engineered products and innovative construction solutions are used in a variety of sectors from residential to infrastructure.
We help our ambitious construction partners to turn architectural visions into reality and build better, safer, stronger and faster. Our engineers provide technical design assistance at every stage of a project, from initial planning to installation and beyond. Our technical support services range from simple product selection through to the development of a fully customised project-specific design solution. Our digital engineering tools include industry-leading calculation and design software and BIM objects.
Every promise we make locally, has the commitment and dedication of our global team behind it. Leviat employs almost 3,000 people at 60 locations across North America, Europe and Asia-Pacific, providing an agile and responsive service worldwide.
A CRH company, Leviat is part of the leading building materials business in the world.
Position Overview
We’re looking for a talented and suitably experienced person to join us as an IT Business Process Expert – Manufacturing & Quality to be based in one of our offices in across Europe. In this pivotal role you will ensure the effective delivery of relevant application services by leveraging your specialist system knowledge and proven business knowledge in the areas of Manufacturing and Quality Management Additionally, you will work to translates business specifications and effective, efficient and compliant business solutions as required. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work on business change projects, defining priorities for the DevOps support partner via the enhancement process. As the subject matter expert you’ll also provide specialist application and solution support for specific elements of the applications estate.
Above all, you are up for a challenge and are adaptable as new requirements arise and are ready to progress your career to the next level with Leviat.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
In this role you will be responsible for a number of tasks including:
Working as a subject matter expert for a relevant defined application and functional scope on business projects in line with business strategy
Quickly grasping user requirements and solution options
Owning the enhancements and related project tasks and translating functional requirements into solution design, build, test (co-ordinating UAT) and deployment
Working on agreed projects and changes within the agreed time limits
Building solutions that comply right first time by design; supported by your basic understanding of GDPR, SOx and other information security policies
Providing expert second-line support to IT users in line with agreed SLAs
Investigating incidents and identifying and mobilising required resources to aid resolution, or acts to escalate SLA breaches
Acting as a subject matter expert in the change management process
Stakeholder engagement as the vendor liaison to support service delivery to agreed SLAs
Supporting the incident root cause analysis process, Initiates problem management
Promoting and supporting continuous process improvement
Ensuring compliance with internal control processes and procedures as required
Key competencies and relevant experience
To be successful in this role it is likely that you will be educated to degree standard or able to demonstrate appropriate significant and relevant experience in Sales and Distribution systems and processes such as eCommerce principles. Ideally you will be certified in Sap (S/4Hana) in PP/QM and no less than 2-3 years proven experience in a SAP consulting environment.

Job Description:
Job ID: 273259
Leviat, a CRH company, is a global leader in insulating, lifting, anchoring, and connecting technology for the construction industry. Leviat’s engineered products and innovative construction solutions are used in a variety of market segments from residential to infrastructure, enabling users to build better, stronger, safer, and faster. The company employs nearly 3,000 people at 60 locations globally. Leviat’s suite of trusted product brands include Meadow Burke, Halfen, and Thermomass.
About Leviat
Leviat is a world leader in connecting, fixing, lifting and anchoring technology for the construction industry. Our trusted product brands, including Ancon, HALFEN, Plaka and Meadow Burke, are all known for high performance, quality and reliability. These engineered products and innovative construction solutions are used in a variety of sectors from residential to infrastructure.
We help our ambitious construction partners to turn architectural visions into reality and build better, safer, stronger and faster. Our engineers provide technical design assistance at every stage of a project, from initial planning to installation and beyond. Our technical support services range from simple product selection through to the development of a fully customised project-specific design solution. Our digital engineering tools include industry-leading calculation and design software and BIM objects.
Every promise we make locally, has the commitment and dedication of our global team behind it. Leviat employs almost 3,000 people at 60 locations across North America, Europe and Asia-Pacific, providing an agile and responsive service worldwide.
A CRH company, Leviat is part of the leading building materials business in the world.
Position Overview
We’re looking for a talented and suitably experienced person to join us as an IT Business Process Expert – Manufacturing & Quality to be based in one of our offices in across Europe. In this pivotal role you will ensure the effective delivery of relevant application services by leveraging your specialist system knowledge and proven business knowledge in the areas of Manufacturing and Quality Management Additionally, you will work to translates business specifications and effective, efficient and compliant business solutions as required. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work on business change projects, defining priorities for the DevOps support partner via the enhancement process. As the subject matter expert you’ll also provide specialist application and solution support for specific elements of the applications estate.
Above all, you are up for a challenge and are adaptable as new requirements arise and are ready to progress your career to the next level with Leviat.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
In this role you will be responsible for a number of tasks including:
Working as a subject matter expert for a relevant defined application and functional scope on business projects in line with business strategy
Quickly grasping user requirements and solution options
Owning the enhancements and related project tasks and translating functional requirements into solution design, build, test (co-ordinating UAT) and deployment
Working on agreed projects and changes within the agreed time limits
Building solutions that comply right first time by design; supported by your basic understanding of GDPR, SOx and other information security policies
Providing expert second-line support to IT users in line with agreed SLAs
Investigating incidents and identifying and mobilising required resources to aid resolution, or acts to escalate SLA breaches
Acting as a subject matter expert in the change management process
Stakeholder engagement as the vendor liaison to support service delivery to agreed SLAs
Supporting the incident root cause analysis process, Initiates problem management
Promoting and supporting continuous process improvement
Ensuring compliance with internal control processes and procedures as required
Key competencies and relevant experience
To be successful in this role it is likely that you will be educated to degree standard or able to demonstrate appropriate significant and relevant experience in Sales and Distribution systems and processes such as eCommerce principles. Ideally you will be certified in Sap (S/4Hana) in PP/QM and no less than 2-3 years proven experience in a SAP consulting environment.
You’ll be a highly effective communicator able to ‘talk’ both technical and non-technical and be able to understand enterprise architecture comments. You should also be able to demonstrate your support for innovative thinking and continuous improvement.
Additional skills in being adept at defining and building system solutions from business requirements as well as creating systems design and rigorous implementation will also be within your capability. You will be able to demonstrate problem analysis and solving and be adept at producing high quality documentation and evidence your skills in process orientation and of quality process mapping production. Knowledge of SAP variant configurator would also be advantageous, but is not essential. Finally you’ll be expected to be fluent in English.
Leviat, a CRH Company Offers You:
A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion
Highly competitive base pay
Competitive secondary benefits
Health and wellness programs
Leviat is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Job Title: Global Program Director EP2P - Amsterdam or Dublin - Europe
Job Description:
Country: Netherlands
City: Amsterdam
Req ID: 272500
About CRH
CRH is the leading global diversified building materials business in the world, employing more than 70,000 people at 3,100 locations worldwide. We manufacture and supply a diverse range of superior building materials and products, used extensively in the built environment, in infrastructure, housing and commercial construction projects, of all sizes, all across the world. Each day, millions of people around the world come into contact with our materials and products which help fulfill the basic human need of shelter and the infrastructure we need for our societies to thrive.
Position Overview
We’re looking for a talented and suitably qualified leader to join us as the owner of the Electronic Procure to Pay (EP2P) program management in the role of Global Program Director EP2P based in our offices in Amsterdam or Dublin. In this exciting and challenging role you will be focused on the implementation, ownership and maintenance of the project management process (PMP) along with the coaching of functional leaders within the program regarding the use of the PMP. The purpose of the role is to achieve consistency and a recognisable way of managing change projects as well as ensuring knowledge retention across the procurement and finance functions with a successful implementation of EP2P across the group.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
In this role you will be responsible for a number of tasks including:
Program management excellence; i.e. building close and effective relationships with key internal and external stakeholders including the Program Steering Committee; Procurement, Finance, IT Leadership, HR and third-party suppliers
Leading an agile way of working with project teams and SMEs to deliver best practice PMP to implement EP2P and related process changes
Delivering program governance standards that are maintained across the project, including SteerCo, delivery and reporting
Developing local PMP including how CRH work, with a particular focus on approach, readiness assessments, implementation of tools and processes, Operating Companies and supplier on-boarding
Ensuring a consistent level of quality in project management across the program
Following up on planning and facilitation of gate reviews across the different (change) projects with the project and stream leads
Maintaining a single program overview for ease of reporting to relevant leadership teams - Global Leadership Team; Procurement; Finance; IT; HR and Global Procurement Council. containing a clear benefit realisation plan and ensuring all tangible benefits are captured throughout the transformation
Coaching of program team members and stream leads as required
Key competencies and relevant experience
To be successful in this role you will need to be educated to degree level in either a business or IT related subject and possess proven senior procurement experience gained in a large, matrixed organisation. Your extensive experience in program management in an international setting should be complimented by your proven experience in people management. You should be fluent in both written and verbal English, other languages are considered advantageous. As this is global role with an international remit there will be extensive travel (up to 50%).
You’ll be an experienced and ambitious senior procurement leader with demonstrable business acumen who has managed global or regional procurement implementation programmes. Your well rounded professional approach is supported by your sound business acumen. You’ll be driven and proactive in your desire to support the execution of the strategic procurement agenda by coordinating process improvement projects and transformations including change management and communications.
As a dedicated and engaged team player you’ll collaborate readily with the both the global and regional functions in and outside Procurement such as Finance/IT/HR and strive for continuous improvement of our procurement operating model.
As a global employer CRH are also able to offer this opportunity to be based out of America, click here for further details.
What CRH Offers You
 A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion
Highly competitive base pay
Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
Group retirement savings program
Health and wellness programs
Excellent opportunities to develop and progress with a global organisation
WORKING AT CRH
As a multinational and multicultural organization, CRH recognizes that our diverse and talented global workforce is critical to sustaining competitive advantage and long-term success. At CRH we want to challenge all of our employees to reach their full potential and play their part in the success of our business. We place a strong focus on developing and empowering our employees to help ensure that we have the talent and capabilities we need now and in the future. We also strive to provide an attractive, rewarding and stimulating modern work environment that will engage and inspire our employees to meet the ever evolving standards and expectations of our customers.
COMPENSATION
We offer an international workplace with a lot of opportunities, freedom and flexibility. As such, self – starters who enjoy working in a challenging environment and who can play a role in shaping our future are encouraged to join CRH. We take care of our employees and therefore offer a generous total rewards package, a diverse and inclusive culture and professional development opportunities.

You should be fluent in both written and verbal English, other languages are considered advantageous. As this is global role with an international remit there will be extensive travel (up to 50%).
You’ll be an experienced and ambitious senior procurement leader with demonstrable business acumen who has managed global or regional procurement implementation programmes. Your well rounded professional approach is supported by your sound business acumen. You’ll be driven and proactive in your desire to support the execution of the strategic procurement agenda by coordinating process improvement projects and transformations including change management and communications.
As a dedicated and engaged team player you’ll collaborate readily with the both the global and regional functions in and outside Procurement such as Finance/IT/HR and strive for continuous improvement of our procurement operating model.
As a global employer CRH are also able to offer this opportunity to be based out of America, click here for further details.
What CRH Offers You
 A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion
Highly competitive base pay
Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
Group retirement savings program
Health and wellness programs
Excellent opportunities to develop and progress with a global organisation
WORKING AT CRH
As a multinational and multicultural organization, CRH recognizes that our diverse and talented global workforce is critical to sustaining competitive advantage and long-term success. At CRH we want to challenge all of our employees to reach their full potential and play their part in the success of our business. We place a strong focus on developing and empowering our employees to help ensure that we have the talent and capabilities we need now and in the future. We also strive to provide an attractive, rewarding and stimulating modern work environment that will engage and inspire our employees to meet the ever evolving standards and expectations of our customers.
COMPENSATION
We offer an international workplace with a lot of opportunities, freedom and flexibility. As such, self – starters who enjoy working in a challenging environment and who can play a role in shaping our future are encouraged to join CRH. We take care of our employees and therefore offer a generous total rewards package, a diverse and inclusive culture and professional development opportunities.

Job Title: Global Program Director EP2P - Amsterdam or Dublin - Europe
Job Description:
Country: Netherlands
City: Amsterdam
Req ID: 272500
About CRH
CRH is the leading global diversified building materials business in the world, employing more than 70,000 people at 3,100 locations worldwide. We manufacture and supply a diverse range of superior building materials and products, used extensively in the built environment, in infrastructure, housing and commercial construction projects, of all sizes, all across the world. Each day, millions of people around the world come into contact with our materials and products which help fulfill the basic human need of shelter and the infrastructure we need for our societies to thrive.
Position Overview
We’re looking for a talented and suitably qualified leader to join us as the owner of the Electronic Procure to Pay (EP2P) program management in the role of Global Program Director EP2P based in our offices in Amsterdam or Dublin. In this exciting and challenging role you will be focused on the implementation, ownership and maintenance of the project management process (PMP) along with the coaching of functional leaders within the program regarding the use of the PMP. The purpose of the role is to achieve consistency and a recognisable way of managing change projects as well as ensuring knowledge retention across the procurement and finance functions with a successful implementation of EP2P across the group.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
In this role you will be responsible for a number of tasks including:
Program management excellence; i.e. building close and effective relationships with key internal and external stakeholders including the Program Steering Committee; Procurement, Finance, IT Leadership, HR and third-party suppliers
Leading an agile way of working with project teams and SMEs to deliver best practice PMP to implement EP2P and related process changes
Delivering program governance standards that are maintained across the project, including SteerCo, delivery and reporting
Developing local PMP including how CRH work, with a particular focus on approach, readiness assessments, implementation of tools and processes, Operating Companies and supplier on-boarding
Ensuring a consistent level of quality in project management across the program
Following up on planning and facilitation of gate reviews across the different (change) projects with the project and stream leads
Maintaining a single program overview for ease of reporting to relevant leadership teams - Global Leadership Team; Procurement; Finance; IT; HR and Global Procurement Council. containing a clear benefit realisation plan and ensuring all tangible benefits are captured throughout the transformation
Coaching of program team members and stream leads as required
Key competencies and relevant experience
To be successful in this role you will need to be educated to degree level in either a business or IT related subject and possess proven senior procurement experience gained in a large, matrixed organisation. Your extensive experience in program management in an international setting should be complimented by your proven experience in people management. You should be fluent in both written and verbal English, other languages are considered advantageous. As this is global role with an international remit there will be extensive travel (up to 50%).
You’ll be an experienced and ambitious senior procurement leader with demonstrable business acumen who has managed global or regional procurement implementation programmes. Your well rounded professional approach is supported by your sound business acumen. You’ll be driven and proactive in your desire to support the execution of the strategic procurement agenda by coordinating process improvement projects and transformations including change management and communications.
As a dedicated and engaged team player you’ll collaborate readily with the both the global and regional functions in and outside Procurement such as Finance/IT/HR and strive for continuous improvement of our procurement operating model.
As a global employer CRH are also able to offer this opportunity to be based out of America, click here for further details.
What CRH Offers You
 A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion
Highly competitive base pay
Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
Group retirement savings program
Health and wellness programs
Excellent opportunities to develop and progress with a global organisation
WORKING AT CRH
As a multinational and multicultural organization, CRH recognizes that our diverse and talented global workforce is critical to sustaining competitive advantage and long-term success. At CRH we want to challenge all of our employees to reach their full potential and play their part in the success of our business. We place a strong focus on developing and empowering our employees to help ensure that we have the talent and capabilities we need now and in the future. We also strive to provide an attractive, rewarding and stimulating modern work environment that will engage and inspire our employees to meet the ever evolving standards and expectations of our customers.
COMPENSATION
We offer an international workplace with a lot of opportunities, freedom and flexibility. As such, self – starters who enjoy working in a challenging environment and who can play a role in shaping our future are encouraged to join CRH. We take care of our employees and therefore offer a generous total rewards package, a diverse and inclusive culture and professional development opportunities.

Job Title: 菜鸟 Sr. Manager, Regional Sorting Center Operations Amsterdam, the Netherlands
Job Description:
Responsible for overall planning of three major sorting centers at Liege eHub, Madrid and Paris, including process identification, management, and continuous improvement for the efficiency and cost reduction.
above 5 year experience in regional sorting center planning/management and operation; Strong logical and data analytical skills, Strong expressive capability; Good at mobilizing internal resources, able to manage teams across borders; Experience with big four express, Amazon and major EU regional express and China domestic major sorting center construction and operation are preferred; Fluent in both Chinese and English.

Please submit resumes in English for consideration.Primary Role: The UK/European Business Development Manager will focus on serving and growing our existing accounts and identifying and closing new business with architectural/commercial/industrial opportunities in the UK and Europe. The range of responsibilities include outside sales, customer service, product training and promotions, problem resolution, special events/conferences, and strategic planning for customer and prospect visits.Reporting to the Director of Sales and Marketing: Specific Areas of Responsibility:Grow existing accounts and identify and develop new accounts and dealers/distributors that fit Sansin’s business profile in the architectural, OEM and commercial construction spaceDevelop strategic plans for territory and individual customers ahead of sales visits, identifying sales goals and a detailed roadmap outlining how to hit sales targetPerform market/competitive research about target markets or customers as a part of business strategyProvide proactive communication with team members across different time zonesBook orders, target and land new business, as well as grow current accounts according to aggressive sales targetsPresent monthly reporting and key performance indicators to ensure progress towards goalsPresent product solutions and technical information to architects, OEMS and others in the building industry via phone, video call or in person visitsConsistent use of CRM to support and develop customer relationships and new businessDevelop and grow Sansin’s specification and maintenance program with architects and other design professionalsLead customer training and launch eventsHandle Tier 2 customer service callsAbility to learn about a variety of products quickly and how to advise customers on what products to use for wood protection by wood species, type of building, location, etc.Qualifications/Skills: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college/university (final semester applicants welcome). Business/Communications degrees a plusDemonstrated success in a sales-driven career, attaining and exceeding sales targetsExperience in construction, building, coatings or architectural industry an assetExperience with CRMHard-working, assertive and self-motivatedAbility to take direction, while also demonstrating success in leading teams and effortsSuperior time management skills, coupled with the ability to organize and prioritizeAbility to make independent decisions in a fast-paced environmentRequirements: Ability to travel up to 50% during peak timesStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work full time hours; more when required in peak seasons in order to reach sales targetsMust have a full driver’s licenseIf interested, please respond by submitting your resume.We thank all interested candidates, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Sansin Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from women, Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, and members of visible minority groups.
