About JLG, an Oshkosh company
JLG began in 1969, when our founder, John L. Grove set out to resolve growing safety concerns in the construction industry. Since then we have been committed to understanding the challenges and delivering innovative solutions to the access market. We partner with customers to provide quality equipment, training opportunities and trusted support within the access industry. We are a global company, and our products—including mobile elevating work platforms, telehandlers, utility vehicles and accessories—can be found all over the world.
The team
In total about 60 people work in our European Shared Service Centre in Hoofddorp in Finance, HR, Sales, Marketing and Legal. The Finance department consists of over 15 professionals. Candidates that like to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment and feel well in a culturally diverse working place are likely to be successful.
The role

The GL Accountant will be part of the GL (Accounting) team. In this role you will report to the Supervisor Accounting. For this position you will be located in our Shared Services Center in Hoofddorp, The Netherlands.
The purpose of this position is to perform general accounting functions and assist in the statutory process within a fast-growing international company. In this capacity your role is a link between activities in the United States and the EMEA Region (Europe, Middle East and Africa). Tasks include month-end and statutory reporting for one or more legal entities and involvement in financial projects. The successful applicant will work closely together with other finance departments (Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Financial Planning & Analysis, and Payroll) to ensure control and compliance.
The successful candidate will be involved with the functions listed below:
Coordinate, assist and drive the preparation and completion of Audits (Group, Statutory, Internal, SOX and Tax) of assigned legal entities
Perform and manage month end close activities.
Perform monthly Blackline balance sheet reconciliations and ensure variances are resolved.
Own the monthly, quarterly and annual closing of one or more EMEA legal entities.
Liaison with Corporate tax function/ external tax consultants and ensure the timely filing of corporate income tax and local statistical reporting.
Propose and drive changes and improvements in the accounting process.
Prepare, validate and make journal entries for designated companies.
Create and maintain a strong environment to enable information gathering for fiscal, legal and accounting purposes.
Support process improvements and system implementations to ensure enhancements of reporting processes across the EMEA locations.
Participate in regional balance sheet and cost reviews with decision support teams.
Preparation of local tax reports.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting, or a relevant field.
At least 3 years of relevant accounting experience, preferably in an international environment.
An experienced Auditor without accounting experience can also be considered for this role.
Multiple-country GL Accounting experience is advantageous.
Knowledge of Dutch tax legislation is advantageous.
Fluent in English. Knowledge of other European languages is advantageous.
Knowledge of Financial / Accounting ERP systems.
Knowledge of MS Office.

“Hands-on” mentality.
Shows initiative and provides good follow-up on areas of responsibility, especially in the area of the accounting process.
Teamplayer. Together we are better.

You will collaborate closely with Microsoft’s local Datacenter Operations teams to maintain ICS high availability and security and provide hands-on escalation support, oversight, and guidance. You will own site level ICS program and project management, and both govern and directly participate in the execution of global initiatives related to ICS systems. You will govern logical and physical access, approval, and permissions related to all ICS systems, networks, workstations, and servers that provide datacenter monitoring, controls, and telemetry. From assisting DC Operations with maintenance & safety procedures (via monitoring system outputs), to operating and maintaining these systems directly, you will be a steward of vital ICS infrastructure.

We are looking for an enthusiastic candidate with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics. Would you like to work in an international research group in an academic environment? Please apply at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam.


In medicine, the interest in molecular imaging has exploded in the last decade. Direct in vivo molecular imaging will become increasingly important as therapies become more specialized and molecule-specific to the disease. This requires visualizing molecular expression and molecular interaction at the cellular level and imaging in detail tissue structure and function in vivo .


The goal of the NWO-TTW Perspectief program “Medical Photonics - MEDPHOT” is to develop and validate photonics-based imaging technologies that enable earlier diagnosis and better and/or tailored treatment of diseases and translate these technologies to a clinical environment in collaborative projects with clinical opinion leaders in pulmonology, urology, and gastroenterology and industrial partners. Advanced physics concepts based on interferometry and cutting-edge technology will be developed to reach these goals.


Within the MEDPHOT program we focus on the development of hybrid optical technologies for combined structural and molecular specific imaging, including the development of novel catheters and capsules specifically optimized for combined detection. Specifically, at the VU high-end OCT systems will be developed that combine structural with targeted fluorescence imaging, i.e., an integrated immuno-OCT platform. New catheters will be designed for multifunctional imaging based on a double clad fiber design. In close collaboration with UMC Groningen (Prof. Nagengast), these catheters will be tested in pilot studies on patients. Algorithms to extract the scattering and absorbing properties of the tissues as well as the concentration of fluorescent contrast agents from the optical signals, for different tissues, will be developed. Polarization properties of tissue and materials have attracted interest in medicine and in industry. The detection of polarization changes are a prime interest, where these properties will be determined not only in tissue but also in collaboration with ASML in semiconductor materials.


Location: AMSTERDAM

FTE: 1
Job description
For this project, we are looking for a PhD student who will develop the measurements systems, develop the advanced processing algorithms for polarization properties, polarization mode dispersion and quantitative fluorescence, and perform the data analysis of in vivo human data, as well as measurements on selected wafer samples provided by ASML. The research will be conducted at the VU in Amsterdam, with regular visits to the UMC Groningen. The candidate will be part of a larger group of PhD students that collaborate closely to reach the final goals of the MEDPHOT program, and are embedded in the Biophotonics research group at the VU under supervision of Prof. Dr. J.F. de Boer.


Your duties
the PhD student will further develop probes for the esophagus, collaborate on the further design and construction of the measurement systems, and develop an excellent understanding of light propagation principles and processing methods to extract tissue information as part of the MEDPHOT program. In collaboration with ASML, the optical properties of sample wafers will be studied
the PhD student will assist in clinical pilot studies by performing the data analysis and interpretation
Requirements
For this position we are looking for an enthusiastic candidate
with a masters or equivalent degree in (applied) physics or a related field, with a strong interest in biomedical optics
candidates should have good understanding of optics, have computational skills (Matlab, Labview) and be able to communicate in English both verbally and in writing. The project’s results will be presented on national and international medical and technical conferences and in relevant journals. The successful candidate is expected to write a dissertation leading to a PhD degree towards the end of the 4-year project
What are we offering?
A challenging position in a socially involved organization. On full-time basis the remuneration amounts to a minimum gross monthly salary of €2,395 (PhD) and a maximum €3,061 (PhD), depending on your education and experience. The job profile is based on the university job ranking system and is vacant for 1 FTE.


The initial employment contract will affect a period of 1 year. After a satisfactory evaluation of the initial appointment, the contract will be extended for a total duration of 4 years.


Additionally, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam offers excellent fringe benefits and various schemes and regulations to promote a good work/life balance, such as:
a maximum of 41 days of annual leave based on full-time employment
8% holiday allowance and 8.3% end-of-year bonus
solid pension scheme (ABP)
optional model for designing a personalized benefits package

About Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
The ambition of Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is clear: to contribute to a better world through outstanding education and ground-breaking research. We strive to be a university where personal development and commitment to society play a leading role. A university where people from different disciplines and backgrounds collaborate to achieve innovations and to generate new knowledge. Our teaching and research encompass the entire spectrum of academic endeavor – from the humanities, the social sciences and the natural sciences through to the life sciences and the medical sciences.


Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam is home to more than 26,000 students. We employ over 4,600 individuals. The VU campus is easily accessible and located in the heart of Amsterdam’s Zuidas district, a truly inspiring environment for teaching and research.


Diversity

We are an inclusive university community. Diversity is one of our most important values. We believe that engaging in international activities and welcoming students and staff from a wide variety of backgrounds enhances the quality of our education and research. We are always looking for people who can enrich our world with their own unique perspectives and experiences.


The Faculty of Science

The Faculty of Science inspires researchers and students to find sustainable solutions for complex societal issues. From forest fires to big data, from obesity to medicines and from molecules to the moon: our teaching and research programmes cover the full spectrum of the natural sciences. We share knowledge and experience with leading research institutes and industries, both here in the Netherlands and abroad.


Working at the Faculty of Science means working with students, PhD candidates and researchers, all with a clear focus on their field and a broad view of the world. We employ more than 1,250 staff members, and we are home to around 6,000 students.


About the department of Physics and Astronomy

The Department of Physics and Astronomy at VU Amsterdam offers an active and engaged intellectual community composed of researchers from around the world. Research is focused on four themes: (i) high-energy and gravitational physics, (ii) quantum metrology and laser applications, (iii) physics of life and health, and (iv) physics of photosynthesis and energy. The department is involved in teaching in the programs Physics and Astronomy (joint degree with the University of Amsterdam), Science Business and Innovation, Medical Natural Sciences (all three BSc and MSc), and the BSc program in Mechanical Engineering (together with University of Twente). Furthermore, the department has a strong track record in valorization of its research, including translational research to the clinic (often together with the Amsterdam UMC, location VUmc (on campus) and location AMC), collaborations with industry (e.g. ARCNL), and a thriving startup scene.

and a sample of a written report in English

Knowledge of data center and IDF infrastructure, including experience working with routers, switches, PDUs, interfacility cabling, fiber and copper distribution, wifi access points, telecommunications hardware, desktop computers, laptops, servers, printers and plotters.
Knowledge and application of Inventory Management as it relates to IT Logistics
Knowledge of basic AV hardware installation, support, and maintenance, specifically as it relates to conference rooms
Knowledge of telecommunications and networking testing equipment from microscopes and source and power meters to OTDRs and experience testing across all SONET and Ethernet bandwidths.
Knowledge of telecommunications testing standards and procedures from length, wire-mapping, and bit error rate to power, delay, loss, reflectance and dispersion.
Knowledge of state and local regulatory standards, procedures, and permitting requirements.
Ability to work effectively with local exchange carrier (LEC) and other telecom service provider technicians, building landlords, electricians, construction operators, and non-technical end users.
Ability to work independently, diagnose problems and take appropriate action with minimal supervision.
Experience with spreadsheets, workflow and project management applications, and administrative software applications.
Ability to lift 50 -70 pounds and the ability to un-box and move equipment for several contiguous hours days
Understanding of how to use a Tier-1 ITSM platform
Preferred Qualifications:
Customer Service Oriented
COMPTIA A+ certification
COMPTIA Network+ certification
Infrastructure & Desktop Hardware Maintenance and Troubleshooting
OS troubleshooting/support (Linux, MacOS, Windows, ChromeOS)
ITIL V3 Foundations Certification
Application of ITSM, Incident, Service Request, Problem, Change Management ticketing systems such as ServiceNow, Remedy, etc.
Detail Oriented
Strong Written and Verbal Communication
Strong Time Management
Self-Motivated
Physical Demand & Work Environment:
Must have the ability to perform office-related tasks which may include prolonged sitting or standing
Must have the ability to move from place to place within an office environment
Must be able to use a computer
Must have the ability to communicate effectively
Some positions may require occasional repetitive motion or movements of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers
What can Astreya offer you?
Employment in the fast-growing IT space providing you with a variety of career options
Opportunity to work with some of the biggest customers in the world
Introduction to new ways of working and awesome technologies
Career paths to help you establish where you want to go
Focus on internal promotion and internal mobility - we love to build teams from within
Free 24/7 accessible Professional Development through LinkedIn Learning and other online courses to give you opportunities to upskill at your own pace
Education Assistance
Dedicated management to provide you with on point leadership and care
Numerous on the job perks
Market competitive compensation and insurance, health and wellness benefits

Additional Information
Astreya Partners is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. We evaluate qualified applicants on merit and business needs and not on race, color, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status or any other factor protected by law.

Job Title: IT Solution Architect | APG - Flexible, Europe
Job Description:
Country: Netherlands
City: Amsterdam
273519
About CRH
CRH is the leading global diversified building materials business in the world with over 3,100 locations worldwide. We manufacture and supply a diverse range of superior building materials and products, used extensively in the built environment, in infrastructure, housing and commercial construction projects, of all sizes, all across the world.
To find out more, visit our website www.crh.com.
Position Overview
We are looking for a talented and suitable qualified individual to join our centralised IT department as a Solution Architect based in our corporate offices in Amsterdam or our local business offices in Europe.
In this role, you will proactively and holistically lead and support the development and implementation of a portfolio of technology solutions for APG Europe.

The Solution Architect requires a clear understanding of business goals, objectives, value-streams, outcomes, capabilities, and processes and will provide the necessary leadership, analysis and design acumen to support the development of technology solutions that meet business needs that align with APG standards and principles. As well as will act as part of the Design Authority and manages the transformation of many processes that will require business process reengineering and extensive stakeholder management.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
Translate Business Strategy into Solutions Architecture
Work with the appropriate business SMEs and project teams to review and understand the business’ expectations, evaluate requirements and propose options.
Recommend business process changes by identifying opportunities that can be enabled with new or better-aligned technology solutions
Build collaborative relationships across APG to facilitate change and technology adoption
Technical Solutions Analysis and Design
Determine operational objectives by studying business functions and current practices; gathering information, evaluating processes and output requirements
Create reference architectures focused on defined APG principles and technology strategies
Design new systems and applications by analysing requirements; documenting solution architectures; defining new system capabilities and integrations; writing specifications.
Understand and simplify systems inter-dependencies by leveraging standard integrations and APIs
Maintain user confidence by protecting and enhancing current business capabilities and operations
Delivery of Solutions & Business Outcomes
Develop a roadmap for the evolution of APG Europe’s application portfolio and reference architecture, including buy versus build options and the sequencing of initiatives
Participate in system delivery projects by providing expertise and hands-on input as necessary
Monitor project progress by tracking activities; resolving risks/issues; recommending actions
Assist in identifying organisational and business process change actions
Key competencies and relevant experience
To be successful in this role you will need to be educated to bachelor or master’s degree level and possess previous Solution Architect or similar experience ideally gained within an international IT setting.

You will be a well-rounded professional with sound business acumen. Experienced in working within a large, multifaceted organisation, consisting of cross-functional teams with good knowledge of various aspects of application architecture definition in terms of structure, dependencies and the mapping to business capabilities/processes.
Specific Requirements;
Ability to develop and prepare business cases, functional specifications and technical requirements
Process re-engineering and optimisation skills, Six Sigma certification desirable
Good understanding of product management, agile & DevOps principles
Strong stakeholder management and influencing skills - Ability to effectively work and communicate with people with a wide range of skills, cultures and capabilities.
Demonstrated commitment toward customer service.
Experience with scalable, sustainable, global ERP systems in the manufacturing industry (such as SAP, Infor, Dynamics, Oracle, NetSuite, Softlab)
Experience with SCM modules and Logistics - Desirable
Working knowledge of modelling languages (UML, etc.) - Desirable
What CRH Offers You
Highly competitive terms and conditions (including but not just basic and performance-related pay)
Health, wellness and safety programs
Excellent opportunities to develop and progress with a global organisation
CRH is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Vacancy: Senior Scala Developer Maarssen

Would you like to work for one of the leading E-Health tech companies here in the Netherland?
Do you enjoy working in an environment where you can have a lot of impact with systems that almost every person in the NL, can benefit from and even save lives?
Do you like many new construction issues that are developed with technologies such as: Scala, Akka HTTP / Streams, Kafka, Cats, Kubernetes, Docker, CQRS, AWS and Elasticsearch?

Don't wait any longer, we have the job for you!

Your employer: Leading E-Health Tech company knows how to surprise time and again with innovation

Ever since its foundation, decades ago, this medium-sized tech company has been a leader in the development of mission-critical E-Health solutions. 90% of primary care and all hospitals in the Netherlands depend on the products of this tech company. So you can say that people are making a huge positive impact here every day.

Through continuous innovation, people are able to raise the bar again and again and take healthcare in the Netherlands to a higher level. A completely new platform will be developed that will make a major contribution to the influence that we as a patient have on our care. So no longer dependent on choices of others, but also determine yourself about the care you receive. This will completely change the way we receive care in the Netherlands. In a positive sense then! This new platform has a lot of complex challenges, including scaling, which must be available to 17 million people in the Netherlands. You can work here with a nicemodern tech stack that includes Scala, Akka HTTP / Streams, Kafka, Cats, Kubernetes, Docker, CQRS, AWS and Elasticsearch.

All this has resulted in you working here in a proud and ambitious working environment with a high software engineering level. Yet people here have remained very informal, down to earth and the working atmosphere is therefore very relaxed with an excellent work-life balance. You will find a lot of flexibility here such as home working days, flexible times. There is enough room here for personal development and the disciplines here are divided over Squads, which together look at how organizations can continue to innovate broadly.

Does this sound like something to you?

Your role: Senior Scala developer Maarssen

In your role as Senior Scala Developer Maarssen you will work in one of the most innovative teams within the organization. Because new products are being developed here, you have a lot of greenfield and the amount of legacy code is limited to the minimum. The team is end to end responsible for its own product. You build it, you run it. You and your team of experienced Scala Developers are going to build a new product that will form a very important part of a mission-critical chain within healthcare. The challenge here is that it is a chain with very complex processes, within a very complex domain. The challenge is to automate this with software engineering best practices such as clean coding. If you like complex puzzles, then you've come to the right place.

What is being asked?
BSc or MSc Computer Science or comparable level
Minimum 5 years of professional Software Development experience
Experience with Scala from own project, professional or Coursera course
Experience with Akka HTTP/Stream and/or Cats is a plus
Experience with Kafka and / or Kubernetes is an advantage
Experience with Docker and / or CQRS is an advantage
Experience with NoSQL technology is a plus
Experience with AWS is an advantage
Experience with Logstash and / or Gatling is an advantage
Experience with Continuous delivery and deployment is a plus
Experience with Automated Testing is a plus
What is offered?
Salary between € 70.000 and € 85.000 per year
2-3 days working from home
25 vacation days, but free extra days if you need more :-)
pension plan
Very flexible working hours
The best hardware
Travel allowance
Own parking space
Catered meals during the day
Would you like to work as a Senior Scala Developer Maarssen and to have an impact on the future of how we structure healthcare in the Netherlands and you can combine this in a technically challenging environment?
Respond now and send your resume to Serge Warbout via s.warbout@codeguild.nl or respond using the form below.

Job Title: IT Business Process Expert - Manufacturing & Quality - Flexible - Europe
Job Description:
Job ID: 273259
Leviat, a CRH company, is a global leader in insulating, lifting, anchoring, and connecting technology for the construction industry. Leviat’s engineered products and innovative construction solutions are used in a variety of market segments from residential to infrastructure, enabling users to build better, stronger, safer, and faster. The company employs nearly 3,000 people at 60 locations globally. Leviat’s suite of trusted product brands include Meadow Burke, Halfen, and Thermomass.
About Leviat
Leviat is a world leader in connecting, fixing, lifting and anchoring technology for the construction industry. Our trusted product brands, including Ancon, HALFEN, Plaka and Meadow Burke, are all known for high performance, quality and reliability. These engineered products and innovative construction solutions are used in a variety of sectors from residential to infrastructure.
We help our ambitious construction partners to turn architectural visions into reality and build better, safer, stronger and faster. Our engineers provide technical design assistance at every stage of a project, from initial planning to installation and beyond. Our technical support services range from simple product selection through to the development of a fully customised project-specific design solution. Our digital engineering tools include industry-leading calculation and design software and BIM objects.
Every promise we make locally, has the commitment and dedication of our global team behind it. Leviat employs almost 3,000 people at 60 locations across North America, Europe and Asia-Pacific, providing an agile and responsive service worldwide.
A CRH company, Leviat is part of the leading building materials business in the world.
Position Overview
We’re looking for a talented and suitably experienced person to join us as an IT Business Process Expert – Manufacturing & Quality to be based in one of our offices in across Europe. In this pivotal role you will ensure the effective delivery of relevant application services by leveraging your specialist system knowledge and proven business knowledge in the areas of Manufacturing and Quality Management Additionally, you will work to translates business specifications and effective, efficient and compliant business solutions as required. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work on business change projects, defining priorities for the DevOps support partner via the enhancement process. As the subject matter expert you’ll also provide specialist application and solution support for specific elements of the applications estate.
Above all, you are up for a challenge and are adaptable as new requirements arise and are ready to progress your career to the next level with Leviat.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities
In this role you will be responsible for a number of tasks including:
Working as a subject matter expert for a relevant defined application and functional scope on business projects in line with business strategy
Quickly grasping user requirements and solution options
Owning the enhancements and related project tasks and translating functional requirements into solution design, build, test (co-ordinating UAT) and deployment
Working on agreed projects and changes within the agreed time limits
Building solutions that comply right first time by design; supported by your basic understanding of GDPR, SOx and other information security policies
Providing expert second-line support to IT users in line with agreed SLAs
Investigating incidents and identifying and mobilising required resources to aid resolution, or acts to escalate SLA breaches
Acting as a subject matter expert in the change management process
Stakeholder engagement as the vendor liaison to support service delivery to agreed SLAs
Supporting the incident root cause analysis process, Initiates problem management
Promoting and supporting continuous process improvement
Ensuring compliance with internal control processes and procedures as required
Key competencies and relevant experience
To be successful in this role it is likely that you will be educated to degree standard or able to demonstrate appropriate significant and relevant experience in Sales and Distribution systems and processes such as eCommerce principles. Ideally you will be certified in Sap (S/4Hana) in PP/QM and no less than 2-3 years proven experience in a SAP consulting environment.
You’ll be a highly effective communicator able to ‘talk’ both technical and non-technical and be able to understand enterprise architecture comments. You should also be able to demonstrate your support for innovative thinking and continuous improvement.
Additional skills in being adept at defining and building system solutions from business requirements as well as creating systems design and rigorous implementation will also be within your capability. You will be able to demonstrate problem analysis and solving and be adept at producing high quality documentation and evidence your skills in process orientation and of quality process mapping production. Knowledge of SAP variant configurator would also be advantageous, but is not essential. Finally you’ll be expected to be fluent in English.
Leviat, a CRH Company Offers You:
A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion
Highly competitive base pay
Competitive secondary benefits
Health and wellness programs
Leviat is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Job summary | Senior Naval Architect Yacht Building
Senior Naval Architect Yacht Building
Custom-built luxury Mega Yachts
+7 yrs experience as Naval Architect from concept design to construction and sea-trials
A true Naval Architect with broad knowledge and overview of the total Yacht Building process
World class Mega Yacht design studio with excellent development opportunities
Excellent command of English, Dutch is preferred
EU-citizenship is required
Job description | Senior Naval Architect Yacht Building

As Senior Naval Architect you have an all-round naval architectural responsibility in the full design engineering cycle of top-end Mega Yachts. As part of the Naval Architecture department you will be involved in the initial stage of the project. You will focus on performing weight, stability, and propulsion calculations, as your main task will be to determine whether it is feasible to build the vessel based on the specifications received from the designers and sometimes provide input for feasibility of the concept design. You will be cooperating closely with internal and external CFD-specialists, FEM-Engineers, Marine Engineers and Lines Plan Engineers to take the project into basic design.
Our client is an international bureau specialized in design, engineering, research & development of luxury custom-built motor Superyachts. The exceptional quality of their products comes from the way of working together and sharing the knowledge on a daily basis. This Design Engineering office is part of a larger Mega Yacht Building organizations with several yards in the Netherlands and you will be involved in the total project up to sea-trials and delivery.
Within the Naval Architecture discipline you will encounter weight & stability control, inclination test, hydrodynamics & hull shape optimization, propulsion, tank layout, drive axle & appendages, transport, sea trial & delivery, in addition also regulations such as: draft marks & watertight integrity, fire safety & escape routes and noise & vibrations. Furthermore, you tasks include:
Delivering a sound design from concept to sea-trials
Project-based approach to solving design issues
Integrating new technologies into the yacht design
Executing a wide range of naval architectural calculations
Communicating with internal Project Managers and Principal Engineers, as well as with yards and subcontractors
Job requirements | Senior Naval Architect Yacht Building
Bsc. or MSc. in Naval Architecture
+7 years of experience in an all-round Naval Architectural role within Yacht Building or Shipbuilding
Extensive experience in the full design engineering cycle, from concept, through basic and detail to construction, sea-trials and delivery
Solid knowledge of hydromechanics, stability, vessel safety and applicable rules & regulations
Strong solution driven mind-set with a passion to apply new technologies
Good organizational awareness and capable of multidisciplinary thinking
Straightforward and speaking your mind
Excellent English communication skills in writing and speaking
EU-citizenship is required

Vacancy: Senior Devops Engineer Amsterdam GCP
Do you want to fully help multiple organizations with millions of end users into the Cloud?
Would you like to work for a very successful 100% open source minded tech organization from which many very successful worldwide used software products have emerged?
Do you enjoy working on varied, long-term new construction projects from your own office in Amsterdam?
Your employer: open source stronghold around distributed systems

This medium-sized software company has for years been at the forefront of building highly distributed, competitor and mission critical systems that beat the hard of their customers. These systems are already running or have yet to be migrated to a Cloud Native environment. The great thing is that you always work from the office in Amsterdam, together with your colleagues!

With a fiery passion for open source (many commiters), built various commonly used frameworks and several very successful product companies emerging within the walls, you can speak of a true knowledge center around modern application building based on the most modern (java / kotlin) stack! Many of their products and customers are now migrating to a Cloud Native environment, so that as a Devops Engineer you can have a major impact here and work within most modern complex Cloud environments. They are happy to share this knowledge. They regularly speak at seminars, organize many meetups and invest heavily in self-development for you and your colleagues.

The culture is super informal, accessible, enterprising and very knowledgeable. Your colleagues are all people with a passion for building high-quality software. If you are interested in concepts such as scalability, Cloud Native, microservices and building infrastructures, but you don't want to spend years in the same place, this is your option!

Your role: Senior Devops Engineer Amsterdam GCP

As a Senior Devops Engineer Amsterdam GCP you always work with your colleagues in Amsterdam within one of the scrum teams to guide software solutions to the Cloud. The big advantage is that you have the variety of projects, but always work from the office and therefore do not have to visit customers!

You will have the opportunity to set up infrastructure within the Cloud for different organizations with different challenges and scales, mainly working with GCP, Kubernetes and Helm. You and your team also ensure that CI / CD pipelines are set up and automated, Cloud environments of different customers remain in the air and you set up Cloud environments for different customers.

A major project will follow shortly, for which a new team of several Cloud Devops specialists will be set up. You will have the opportunity and freedom to form this team and, together with your colleagues, set up the infrastructure from scratch for a self-developed tool for larger organizations with millions of end users. Together with your team, you will ensure that this tool and the platform run completely within a Cloud Native environment.

Because you work in a team with the people of your organization, you always deliver projects based on your standards. In this way you guarantee that it meets what you have in mind. You can of course also continuously spar with your direct colleagues, which leads to even better and faster results.

Given their experience in successfully setting up various product companies, you will also find a unique opportunity to set up one of your own ideas in the future under the guidance of heavyweights!

What is being asked?
1+ year of experience with AWS, Azure or GCP Cloud Technologies
Completed HBO or WO education in the field of Computer Science or similar
Passion for Cloud and Infrastructure
Experience with Kubernetes and Helm
Experience with Terraform or CloudFormation
Experience with Spring Boot is a plus
Experience with Databases such as Postgress and Mysql is a plus
Experience with ICO27001 security policy is a plus
Experience with Jira Confluence is a plus
What is offered?
Between € 65,000 and € 75,000 gross per year
Excellent pension
The ability to work 32, 36 and 40 hours
Free lunch
Extensive training budget
High end Macbook or laptop of your choice
The opportunity to attend many seminars and meetups
highly specialized own training courses
very intelligent and passionate colleagues
the possibility to work from home
Interested in the job with these open source fanatics with a passion for building highly scalable smart systems that often run in the cloud?


Apply now via the form below or send your CV to Wesley Jafar via w.jafar@codeguild.nl

Ben jij bekend met de basisprincipes van elektriciteit en ben je commercieel ingesteld? Dan is dit de vacature voor jou! Voor een mooie organisatie zijn wij op zoek naar een Accountmanager.

Als Accountmanager is het jouw missie om de producten en dienstverlening op de kaart te zetten
Je vertrekt vanuit de bestaande klantenportefeuille en neemt de leiding in de opstart, het bekend maken en verkopen van de professionele laadsystemen voor hybride en elektrische wagens voor privé-en bedrijfsgebruik.
Je legt contacten binnen de sector van Facilities - Construction en Fleet-Lease. Je brengt de markt in kaart, analyseert huidige en toekomstige behoeften en commerciële opportuniteiten. Je initieert de nodige acties om oplossingen "top-of-mind" te maken.
Je bent de directe contactpersoon voor je klanten, staat steeds tot hun dienst en plant regelmatige bezoeken met het oog op het uitbouwen van een lange relatie.
Je neemt initiatief en prospecteert actief (koud), plant klantenbezoeken, presenteert (nieuwe) producten en geeft het gepaste advies, je leidt de klant naar het juiste commerciële voorstel en finaal sluit je de contracten af.
Je structureert en organiseert je agenda, klanteninformatie en beheert de administratieve opvolging van de verkoop.
Je behaalt de vooropgestelde verkoopresultaten.
Wekelijks overleg je jouw resultaat met de salesmanager en de product manager laadoplossingen, je evalueert en bepaalt de strategie voor het aanpakken van de markt en zorgt voor nieuwe oplossingen gebaseerd op deze permanente evaluaties.

Waar ga je werken?
Een internationale organisatie actief in de montagesystemen van zonnepanelen. 1x per week werk je vanuit Deventer en verder ben je in de buitendienst actief in heel Nederland.

Wat vragen wij?
Je hebt een degelijke kennis van de basisprincipes van elektriciteit.
Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring in vergelijkbare sales functies, kennis van de sector van de duurzame energie is een pluspunt.

De klant komt bij jou altijd op de eerste plaats, je bent steeds bereikbaar.
Je hebt zin in het aangaan van de uitdagingen binnen een innovatieve en snel evoluerende markt. Je ontwikkelt continu jezelf en je marktkennis.
Je neemt initiatief, je bent actief, onafhankelijk, positief assertief en resultaatgericht.
Je bent vlot, sociaal in de omgang, beleefd en hebt een verzorgd voorkomen.
Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatieve en commerciële vaardigheden ("openen van deuren", analyse van de noden van de klant...)

Je bent in het bezit van een rijbewijs.

Vragen? Dit kan via robert.ouwehand@adecco.nl

Arrange all necessary permits and/or (internal) authorizations for execution of these projects;Support, approve and supervise the fit out works by any commercial tenant (catering, retail or office) and assures fulfilment of Landlord obligations towards these commercial tenants;Support the Property Operations Manager with the management of and liaison with appointed contractors, reviewing control documentation and monitoring work quality;Control maintenance and capex budgets and perform timely and accurate management reporting;Ensure safety standards and (local) regulations are always met;Assigns work orders generated from resident requests for service, as well as routine upkeep on the property by diagnosing the source or cause of the defect or problem, and making repairs in accordance with established policies, procedures, and safety standardsCoordinates contractors/suppliers executing works on siteOversees and completes the turnover process to prepare for the pre-move-out inspection, creating a priority list of maintenance work needed, scheduling vendors and contractors as needed, obtaining required supplies and materials, completing all maintenance tasks, and inspecting completed work.Develops standards for the cleanliness and overall appearance of the community to ensure that they reflect and represent the high quality of the community and Greystar standards.Periodically inspects work performed by maintenance team members to assess effectiveness of policies and procedures and develop corrective action plans as needed.Maintains adequate inventory of spare parts and maintenance materials and works with the Property Operations Manager to order supplies and tools as needed to stay within budgetary guidelines.Ensures regular preventative maintenance plans are carried out at the required intervals to ensure building, equipment and facilities life cycles are met. Ensure annual checks are carried out. Review site risk assessments. Manage & maintain all statutory testing records, utilizing other team members where appropriate.Monitor Contractors/Suppliers performance to standard and retain accurate records of their site operations.Accompany external contractors whilst on site in line with key management and access to accommodation policies and practice.Knowledge & Qualifications:Technical degree (bachelor/HTS or MTS with relevant experience) in a relevant discipline (construction, installations);Proven technical knowledge of building installations and experienced in technical designs;familiar with management op operational maintenance works and capital projects (residential or hotel or retail/offices);Minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience.Knowledge in all building repair trades, purchasing procedures and practices, janitorial, painting and repair procedures.General knowledge/understanding of Health and Safety risks including manual handling, worksite safety, chemicals, trip and fall hazards.Continually strives to improve knowledge, skills and abilities to produce the best results.Experience & Skills:Drive and passion to take ownership and be accountable for the technical property management of the assigned portfolio;Proactive with a can-do attitude and ability to work independently and take ownership of a task/project end to end.Well-organized and proven project management skills;Ability to multitask and prioritize whilst maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail;Flexible approach to working in a fast-paced environment and adaptable to thriving in a changing environment;Clear on communication, pragmatic and direct (not afraid to put an issue on the table);Building maintenance experience in a domestic residential environment (i.e. hotel or private residential block) or experience in a related building trades field consisting of repairs, refurbishing, cleaning, heating, and maintenance administration.Experience of developing and maintaining risk assessments, managing preventative maintenance systems and the ability to support the Property Manager to meet their obligations to operate a safe building.The ability to effectively supervise Contractors and Suppliers.The ability to work the aptitude to determine the most cost-effective solutions to repairs without sacrificing on quality.A positive team player with a flexible and adaptable approach to work.Written & verbal communication skills; excellent in Dutch (circa 90% van de communicatie van deze rol is in het Nederlands) and fair in English, customer service approach, comfort with and awareness of the demands of working a customer-facing role.Application Deadline: 28/02/2021Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Onbepaalde tijdWerkschema:ma-vr

Arrange all necessary permits and/or (internal) authorizations for execution of these projects;Support, approve and supervise the fit out works by any commercial tenant (catering, retail or office) and assures fulfilment of Landlord obligations towards these commercial tenants;Support the Property Operations Manager with the management of and liaison with appointed contractors, reviewing control documentation and monitoring work quality;Control maintenance and capex budgets and perform timely and accurate management reporting;Ensure safety standards and (local) regulations are always met;Assigns work orders generated from resident requests for service, as well as routine upkeep on the property by diagnosing the source or cause of the defect or problem, and making repairs in accordance with established policies, procedures, and safety standardsCoordinates contractors/suppliers executing works on siteOversees and completes the turnover process to prepare for the pre-move-out inspection, creating a priority list of maintenance work needed, scheduling vendors and contractors as needed, obtaining required supplies and materials, completing all maintenance tasks, and inspecting completed work.Develops standards for the cleanliness and overall appearance of the community to ensure that they reflect and represent the high quality of the community and Greystar standards.Periodically inspects work performed by maintenance team members to assess effectiveness of policies and procedures and develop corrective action plans as needed.Maintains adequate inventory of spare parts and maintenance materials and works with the Property Operations Manager to order supplies and tools as needed to stay within budgetary guidelines.Ensures regular preventative maintenance plans are carried out at the required intervals to ensure building, equipment and facilities life cycles are met. Ensure annual checks are carried out. Review site risk assessments. Manage & maintain all statutory testing records, utilizing other team members where appropriate.Monitor Contractors/Suppliers performance to standard and retain accurate records of their site operations.Accompany external contractors whilst on site in line with key management and access to accommodation policies and practice.Knowledge & Qualifications:Technical degree (bachelor/HTS or MTS with relevant experience) in a relevant discipline (construction, installations);Proven technical knowledge of building installations and experienced in technical designs;familiar with management op operational maintenance works and capital projects (residential or hotel or retail/offices);Minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience.Knowledge in all building repair trades, purchasing procedures and practices, janitorial, painting and repair procedures.General knowledge/understanding of Health and Safety risks including manual handling, worksite safety, chemicals, trip and fall hazards.Continually strives to improve knowledge, skills and abilities to produce the best results.Experience & Skills:Drive and passion to take ownership and be accountable for the technical property management of the assigned portfolio;Proactive with a can-do attitude and ability to work independently and take ownership of a task/project end to end.Well-organized and proven project management skills;Ability to multitask and prioritize whilst maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail;Flexible approach to working in a fast-paced environment and adaptable to thriving in a changing environment;Clear on communication, pragmatic and direct (not afraid to put an issue on the table);Building maintenance experience in a domestic residential environment (i.e. hotel or private residential block) or experience in a related building trades field consisting of repairs, refurbishing, cleaning, heating, and maintenance administration.Experience of developing and maintaining risk assessments, managing preventative maintenance systems and the ability to support the Property Manager to meet their obligations to operate a safe building.The ability to effectively supervise Contractors and Suppliers.The ability to work the aptitude to determine the most cost-effective solutions to repairs without sacrificing on quality.A positive team player with a flexible and adaptable approach to work.Written & verbal communication skills; excellent in Dutch (circa 90% van de communicatie van deze rol is in het Nederlands) and fair in English, customer service approach, comfort with and awareness of the demands of working a customer-facing role.Application Deadline: 28/02/2021Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Onbepaalde tijdWerkschema:ma-vr

This role oversees and manages execution of preventive and periodical maintenance and capex works, complying with financial targets, Greystar quality standards (cleanliness, appearance, safety, overall functionality) and local building regulations. You will share your technical experience and knowhow on materialization and installations to the service teams and the on-site maintenance technicians.The TPM oversees and performs technical and mechanical work that ensures the inside and external buildings, grounds, amenities, and common areas of the property meet the Company’s standards for cleanliness, appearance, safety, and overall functionality by performing maintenance-related tasks.JOB DESCRIPTIONKey Role Responsibilities:Tender, negotiate, secure, evaluate and manage all technical-related 3rd party maintenance and service contracts related to real estate, installations and inventory;Plan, manage and supervise maintenance contracts and works, collaborating with the onsite operations team;Contribute to optimal performance of the assets by seeking for continuous optimization of operational costs and capital expenses by smart organization and negotiation;Plan and contract capital expense projects. Arrange all necessary permits and/or (internal) authorizations for execution of these projects;Support, approve and supervise the fit out works by any commercial tenant (catering, retail or office) and assures fulfilment of Landlord obligations towards these commercial tenants;Support the Property Operations Manager with the management of and liaison with appointed contractors, reviewing control documentation and monitoring work quality;Control maintenance and capex budgets and perform timely and accurate management reporting;Ensure safety standards and (local) regulations are always met;Assigns work orders generated from resident requests for service, as well as routine upkeep on the property by diagnosing the source or cause of the defect or problem, and making repairs in accordance with established policies, procedures, and safety standardsCoordinates contractors/suppliers executing works on siteOversees and completes the turnover process to prepare for the pre-move-out inspection, creating a priority list of maintenance work needed, scheduling vendors and contractors as needed, obtaining required supplies and materials, completing all maintenance tasks, and inspecting completed work.Develops standards for the cleanliness and overall appearance of the community to ensure that they reflect and represent the high quality of the community and Greystar standards.Periodically inspects work performed by maintenance team members to assess effectiveness of policies and procedures and develop corrective action plans as needed.Maintains adequate inventory of spare parts and maintenance materials and works with the Property Operations Manager to order supplies and tools as needed to stay within budgetary guidelines.Ensures regular preventative maintenance plans are carried out at the required intervals to ensure building, equipment and facilities life cycles are met. Ensure annual checks are carried out. Review site risk assessments. Manage & maintain all statutory testing records, utilizing other team members where appropriate.Monitor Contractors/Suppliers performance to standard and retain accurate records of their site operations.Accompany external contractors whilst on site in line with key management and access to accommodation policies and practice.Knowledge & Qualifications:Technical degree (bachelor/HTS or MTS with relevant experience) in a relevant discipline (construction, installations);Proven technical knowledge of building installations and experienced in technical designs;familiar with management op operational maintenance works and capital projects (residential or hotel or retail/offices);Minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience.Knowledge in all building repair trades, purchasing procedures and practices, janitorial, painting and repair procedures.General knowledge/understanding of Health and Safety risks including manual handling, worksite safety, chemicals, trip and fall hazards.Continually strives to improve knowledge, skills and abilities to produce the best results.Experience & Skills:Drive and passion to take ownership and be accountable for the technical property management of the assigned portfolio;Proactive with a can-do attitude and ability to work independently and take ownership of a task/project end to end.Well-organized and proven project management skills;Ability to multitask and prioritize whilst maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail;Flexible approach to working in a fast-paced environment and adaptable to thriving in a changing environment;Clear on communication, pragmatic and direct (not afraid to put an issue on the table);Building maintenance experience in a domestic residential environment (i.e. hotel or private residential block) or experience in a related building trades field consisting of repairs, refurbishing, cleaning, heating, and maintenance administration.Experience of developing and maintaining risk assessments, managing preventative maintenance systems and the ability to support the Property Manager to meet their obligations to operate a safe building.The ability to effectively supervise Contractors and Suppliers.The ability to work the aptitude to determine the most cost-effective solutions to repairs without sacrificing on quality.A positive team player with a flexible and adaptable approach to work.Written & verbal communication skills; excellent in Dutch (circa 90% van de communicatie van deze rol is in het Nederlands) and fair in English, customer service approach, comfort with and awareness of the demands of working a customer-facing role.Application Deadline: 28/02/2021Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Onbepaalde tijdWerkschema:ma-vr

SOLLICITATIES ENKEL VIA ONDERSTAANDE LINK: https://greystar.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/EMEA_Career_Site/job/OurDomain-Rotterdam-Blaak/Property-Operations-Manager_R0025225The Technical Property Manager (hereafter: TPM) will work as part of the Operations team with responsibility for the built environment of a branded portfolio “OurDomain” and “OurCampus” targeting students, (young) professionals, couples and friends. This portfolio consists of large-scale residential rental properties in Amsterdam (1559 units, delivered April 2021), Diemen (1718 units) and Rotterdam (612 units, delivered September 2021). An area development in Utrecht is in planning phase. In the coming years, this specific portfolio will grow to over 5000 units. All properties feature extensive amenity spaces, commercial tenants and parking facilities.The TPM is responsible to keep the technical quality of the assets at good standards, which includes preventive and periodical maintenance but also various alterations, upgrades and expansions of these assets. This role oversees and manages execution of preventive and periodical maintenance and capex works, complying with financial targets, Greystar quality standards (cleanliness, appearance, safety, overall functionality) and local building regulations. You will share your technical experience and knowhow on materialization and installations to the service teams and the on-site maintenance technicians.The TPM oversees and performs technical and mechanical work that ensures the inside and external buildings, grounds, amenities, and common areas of the property meet the Company’s standards for cleanliness, appearance, safety, and overall functionality by performing maintenance-related tasks.JOB DESCRIPTIONKey Role Responsibilities:Tender, negotiate, secure, evaluate and manage all technical-related 3rd party maintenance and service contracts related to real estate, installations and inventory;Plan, manage and supervise maintenance contracts and works, collaborating with the onsite operations team;Contribute to optimal performance of the assets by seeking for continuous optimization of operational costs and capital expenses by smart organization and negotiation;Plan and contract capital expense projects. Arrange all necessary permits and/or (internal) authorizations for execution of these projects;Support, approve and supervise the fit out works by any commercial tenant (catering, retail or office) and assures fulfilment of Landlord obligations towards these commercial tenants;Support the Property Operations Manager with the management of and liaison with appointed contractors, reviewing control documentation and monitoring work quality;Control maintenance and capex budgets and perform timely and accurate management reporting;Ensure safety standards and (local) regulations are always met;Assigns work orders generated from resident requests for service, as well as routine upkeep on the property by diagnosing the source or cause of the defect or problem, and making repairs in accordance with established policies, procedures, and safety standardsCoordinates contractors/suppliers executing works on siteOversees and completes the turnover process to prepare for the pre-move-out inspection, creating a priority list of maintenance work needed, scheduling vendors and contractors as needed, obtaining required supplies and materials, completing all maintenance tasks, and inspecting completed work.Develops standards for the cleanliness and overall appearance of the community to ensure that they reflect and represent the high quality of the community and Greystar standards.Periodically inspects work performed by maintenance team members to assess effectiveness of policies and procedures and develop corrective action plans as needed.Maintains adequate inventory of spare parts and maintenance materials and works with the Property Operations Manager to order supplies and tools as needed to stay within budgetary guidelines.Ensures regular preventative maintenance plans are carried out at the required intervals to ensure building, equipment and facilities life cycles are met. Ensure annual checks are carried out. Review site risk assessments. Manage & maintain all statutory testing records, utilizing other team members where appropriate.Monitor Contractors/Suppliers performance to standard and retain accurate records of their site operations.Accompany external contractors whilst on site in line with key management and access to accommodation policies and practice.Knowledge & Qualifications:Technical degree (bachelor/HTS or MTS with relevant experience) in a relevant discipline (construction, installations);Proven technical knowledge of building installations and experienced in technical designs;familiar with management op operational maintenance works and capital projects (residential or hotel or retail/offices);Minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience.Knowledge in all building repair trades, purchasing procedures and practices, janitorial, painting and repair procedures.General knowledge/understanding of Health and Safety risks including manual handling, worksite safety, chemicals, trip and fall hazards.Continually strives to improve knowledge, skills and abilities to produce the best results.Experience & Skills:Drive and passion to take ownership and be accountable for the technical property management of the assigned portfolio;Proactive with a can-do attitude and ability to work independently and take ownership of a task/project end to end.Well-organized and proven project management skills;Ability to multitask and prioritize whilst maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail;Flexible approach to working in a fast-paced environment and adaptable to thriving in a changing environment;Clear on communication, pragmatic and direct (not afraid to put an issue on the table);Building maintenance experience in a domestic residential environment (i.e. hotel or private residential block) or experience in a related building trades field consisting of repairs, refurbishing, cleaning, heating, and maintenance administration.Experience of developing and maintaining risk assessments, managing preventative maintenance systems and the ability to support the Property Manager to meet their obligations to operate a safe building.The ability to effectively supervise Contractors and Suppliers.The ability to work the aptitude to determine the most cost-effective solutions to repairs without sacrificing on quality.A positive team player with a flexible and adaptable approach to work.Written & verbal communication skills; excellent in Dutch (circa 90% van de communicatie van deze rol is in het Nederlands) and fair in English, customer service approach, comfort with and awareness of the demands of working a customer-facing role.Application Deadline: 28/02/2021Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Onbepaalde tijdWerkschema:ma-vr

Company Description
Flink is revolutionizing how we buy groceries. We deliver a selection of 2.000 products to your home - in only 10 minutes. We put customers first and aim to achieve the best customer experience. Founded by experienced ecommerce professionals and backed by some of the most renowned investors in Europe we are growing rapidly and have a great hunger to continuously challenge ourselves. We are a diverse team with a flexible and inclusive culture.

Job Description
Do you want to be a part of this grocery revolution? As (Junior) Launch Manager you will be a vital part of our expansion team that is in charge of setting up new hubs across the country to allow for more people to have access to the Flink grocery experience. Do you enjoy setting up physical stores, work on changing assignments across the country where you coordinate renovation and store setup activities, and get energy from delivering results quickly? Apply now and join our team at Flink.
Responsibilities:
This role is key to our growth agenda within the Netherlands and is part of the expansion team
You work closely with the expansion manager in coordinating store renovation and setup from the moment rental contracts are signed until operations are up and running a few weeks later
Thereby you coordinate construction companies as electricians and painters to transition new locations from their prior usage (e.g. bike shop, gym, supermarket) into a Flink hub
Once the basic renovation is done you coordinate the setup of fridges, shelfs and freezers in a way that allows for smooth operations at the specific location
You involve future hub managers throughout this process to bring him or her up to speed in order to hand over operations once shelves are filled and everything is set up
A few days after the new hub goes live you move on the the next project, to set up another Flink hub either in the same city or somewhere else across the Netherlands
You enjoy seeing quick, tangible results to the work you are doing and enjoy getting your hands dirty
This is a great role to start a career at Flink, allows for a steep learning curve and is exposed to lots of development opportunities

Qualifications

1+ years of experience in a fast-paced environment (e.g. start-up, horeca, hotel industry), ideally in a project-oriented role
Prior experience in dealing with construction companies is a pre
Bachelor degree
Willingness to travel across the Netherlands with home base ideally in the Randstad region
Fluent in Dutch and English
You are a team player at heart
Additional Information
What we offer:
The opportunity to work at one of the best-funded startups in the Netherlands, aiming to completely redefine the way people buy groceries
Build an organisation right from the beginning
Steep learning curve and lot of responsibility right from the start
Transparent company culture with flat hierarchies and a high career growth trajectory at Flink in the Netherlands
Competitive salary and 20% discount on your own groceries
Several other perks like a company boat (soon ;) ), Friday borrel and Monday team lunches
It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

You work closely with the expansion manager in coordinating store renovation and setup from the moment rental contracts are signed until operations are up and running a few weeks later
Thereby you coordinate construction companies as electricians and painters to transition new locations from their prior usage (e.g. bike shop, gym, supermarket) into a Flink hub
Once the basic renovation is done you coordinate the setup of fridges, shelfs and freezers in a way that allows for smooth operations at the specific location
You involve future hub managers throughout this process to bring him or her up to speed in order to hand over operations once shelves are filled and everything is set up
A few days after the new hub goes live you move on the the next project, to set up another Flink hub either in the same city or somewhere else across the Netherlands
You enjoy seeing quick, tangible results to the work you are doing and enjoy getting your hands dirty
This is a great role to start a career at Flink, allows for a steep learning curve and is exposed to lots of development opportunities

Qualifications

1+ years of experience in a fast-paced environment (e.g. start-up, horeca, hotel industry), ideally in a project-oriented role
Prior experience in dealing with construction companies is a pre
Bachelor degree
Willingness to travel across the Netherlands with home base ideally in the Randstad region
Fluent in Dutch and English
You are a team player at heart
Additional Information
What we offer:
The opportunity to work at one of the best-funded startups in the Netherlands, aiming to completely redefine the way people buy groceries
Build an organisation right from the beginning
Steep learning curve and lot of responsibility right from the start
Transparent company culture with flat hierarchies and a high career growth trajectory at Flink in the Netherlands
Competitive salary and 20% discount on your own groceries
Several other perks like a company boat (soon ;) ), Friday borrel and Monday team lunches
It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Job Description
Facility Coordinator – Amsterdam
DPR Construction is seeking a Part time (25 hours per week) Facility Coordinator for our Amsterdam office.
In this role, you will be performing a range of tasks to the highest standards, and you will work closely with the Office Coordinator to ensure the office runs smoothly.
Key Responsibilities
Monitor the reception area and assist guests with where they need to go
Ensure general tidiness of the office, kitchen and rest areas
Manage cleaning, waste and replenishment services
Prepare meeting spaces and services
Manage catering needs for working breakfast /lunch and meetings
Support planning for events
Maintain office supply inventory
Manage parking availability and arrange car services for visitors as needed
Manage incoming and outgoing mail
Prepare outgoing packages and arrange for couriers as needed
Be a point of contact and support for all DPR team-members
Qualifications
We are looking for a flexible, detail-oriented and hands-on team player with the ability to manage multiple tasks and produce quality work. The successful candidate possesses the following characteristics:
Good Dutch and English language/communication skills
Pro-active and highly organized
Available Monday- Friday (preferably 09.00am - 2:30pm)
Strong attention to detail
Flexible; Can juggle multiple, ad-hoc tasks
Enthusiasm for your work and a great attitude
Ability to identify and resolve issues
Experience as Facility Coordinator preferred
Microsoft Office skills preferred
What we offer
A chance to join a leading global construction company and international team
A great opportunity to join a rapidly growing business
A dynamic and innovative work environment
Competitive salary and 25 paid days off per annum pro rata
Transportation allowance
Employee Benefits including private healthcare and Employee Assistance Program
DPR has been nationally recognized for its strong company culture, based on a well-defined purpose “We Exist to Build Great Things,” and four core values: integrity, enjoyment, uniqueness and ever forward. A flat, title-less organization that empowers people at all levels to make decisions, DPR ranked on FORTUNE’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” list for five consecutive years. For more information, visit http://www.dpr.com .

Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
NIKE, Inc. Retail Corporate is the backbone to stores around the world. A global network of teams — Finance, Human Resources, Talent Development, Marketing, Merchandising, Real Estate and Strategic Planning — direct the daily operations of Nike.com and the hundreds of Nike Stores and Nike Factory Stores. Retail Corporate teams share the same passion and energy for the brand as their in-store teammates, and it shows: Retail continues to be one of Nike’s top areas of growth.
Lease Acquisition Manager
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
The Nike Direct EMEA team seeks a Lease Acquisition Manager who will help drive our ambitious new store opening and refit program across EMEA, coordinating the lease process and negotiating leases that will enable Nike to achieve its growth and profitability targets.
WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?
Conducting detailed site assessments
Negotiating letter of intents, lease amendments and lease agreements
Monitor and drive actions on critical dates and lease obligations
Optimizing existing store portfolio by conducting renegotiations
Coordinating real estate agencies to support the transaction process
Financial modelling & business cases
Coordinating approval processes
Building marketplace reality
Control and update pipeline reports and any other related project management reports on weekly basis.

WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH?
You’ll be a critical member of the Nike Direct Real Estate team in EMEA. On the daily you’ll be working with colleagues in Construction, Facilities, Finance, Legal, Controlling, Retail Field, Lease Administration, Retail Concepts, as well as you’ll work with landlords, real estate agents and consultants.

WHAT YOU BRING?
At least 5 years of experience in Real Estate preferably in multiple countie
Educatio:n Bachelor's/Master's degree
Strong analytical, communication, presentation and negotiating skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and effectively manage multiple priorities
Results driven
Strong team player with positive attitude
Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team
Fluency in English is essential, written and verbal
Knowledge of Excel and preferably Smartsheet
Travel required

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.
NIKE, Inc. is committed to employing a diverse workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability.

Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world’s best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At NIKE, Inc. it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game.
NIKE, Inc. Retail Corporate is the backbone to stores around the world. A global network of teams — Finance, Human Resources, Talent Development, Marketing, Merchandising, Real Estate and Strategic Planning — direct the daily operations of Nike.com and the hundreds of Nike Stores and Nike Factory Stores. Retail Corporate teams share the same passion and energy for the brand as their in-store teammates, and it shows: Retail continues to be one of Nike’s top areas of growth.
Lease Acquisition Manager
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
The Nike Direct EMEA team seeks a Lease Acquisition Manager who will help drive our ambitious new store opening and refit program across EMEA, coordinating the lease process and negotiating leases that will enable Nike to achieve its growth and profitability targets.
WHAT WILL YOU WORK ON?
Conducting detailed site assessments
Negotiating letter of intents, lease amendments and lease agreements
Monitor and drive actions on critical dates and lease obligations
Optimizing existing store portfolio by conducting renegotiations
Coordinating real estate agencies to support the transaction process
Financial modelling & business cases
Coordinating approval processes
Building marketplace reality
Control and update pipeline reports and any other related project management reports on weekly basis.

WHO WILL YOU WORK WITH?
You’ll be a critical member of the Nike Direct Real Estate team in EMEA. On the daily you’ll be working with colleagues in Construction, Facilities, Finance, Legal, Controlling, Retail Field, Lease Administration, Retail Concepts, as well as you’ll work with landlords, real estate agents and consultants.

WHAT YOU BRING?
At least 5 years of experience in Real Estate preferably in multiple countie

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and effectively manage multiple priorities
Results driven

Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team

Hill International is an international construction consulting firm that provides program and project management, construction management, cost engineering and estimating, quality assurance, inspection, scheduling, risk management and claims avoidance to clients involved in major construction projects worldwide. Hill has participated in over 10,000 project assignments with a total construction value of more than $500 billion. Hill is a publicly traded company listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: HIL), and is headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. (www.hillintl.com)
We are looking for a Complicance Manager for a project in the Netherlands

Qualifications

Experience/Expertise in compliance management, anti bribery, paralegal, FCPA, required
Previous construction-related experience would be an advantage
